Reviews.Title: “Great service and a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyStarnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3 kids here and loved it. Fantastic staff, clean rooms and a great location. The associate who checked us in was kind and helpful. Totally recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktina0126
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, close to bus and transit, within walking distance to numerous resturants and a seven eleven with liquor was right outside, the mall wasnt too far and depending how far you would like to walk, you can walk all the way to the water. The hotel was beautiful, marble floors and nice lounging area in lobby with free computer which was nice. didnt use the resturant which seemed to always be empty. the room itself was very clean and cozy.. a little small but it was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. the HOTEL itself was excellant. the only reason I am giving this hotel a decent rating is because of an incident that happened to me (that may not even happen to you) we visited some friends in CA and when they visited the hotel they used to valet and came up to our room and somehow i found out that they didnt pay for the valet, they actually just charged it to the room. i felt that was extremely rude considering if my friends didnt tell me they charged it.. i would have been stuck paying the valet fee of $30!!!!!!!!! it wasnt my car and i didnt even know they had came to the hotel and i didnt tell them or authorize anyone to charge anything to MY room. i felt that was very horrendous that just anyone could place a charge on your room that you are stuck with.. does that also mean that you can just pull up to valet for the evening in DT san diego and park for free at the hotel and just "charge it" to someone elses room without even knowing them and no one would ever know. i didnt like that AT ALL. other than that i would return, but because of that, i dont know if i would without checking out other hotels first?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Bouffard69
Reviews.Content: I happened upon the Bristol in an online search, and was happy with the price point. When I arrived, I was extremely impressed with the entire property. The room was perfect, exactly what I was hoping for, tasteful and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Turns out it is one block from the county courthouse, which was where I had to be. Horton Plaza (shopping center) is also within walking distance. I've already booked my return trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: DaveYYJ
Reviews.Content: Super friendly staff, great location, clean and comfortable rooms, what more can you ask for. Will happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, customer service second to none.”
Reviews.Author: Sam J
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Bristol for the past 5 years. Just returned from a wonderful weekend. The Hotel is second to note, great location and its customer service is very special. I strongly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Rebekah B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec. for my best friendâ€™s birthday, we figured it was safer to stay downtown rather than drive to and from North County. We were greeted by Valet who were very helpful in un-loading and loading the car. Daily valet rate was $25, which I think is a bit steep for such a small boutique, but the guys were very helpful. The front desk lady was super sweet and very welcoming. Our room was absolutely beautiful, clean, well decorated, and overall fabulous. I will definitely be staying at the hotel again. I now prefer the small boutique hotels rather than the large corporate ones....kudos to the Bristol Hotel for an amazing job!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful staff, beautiful room, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: FarukKor
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here on a day we went to San Diego. It was the best decision we've ever made. The room we stayed in 810 was very clean, beautiful, had nice view and on top of that people who work there were extremely nice and friendly. I'm usually very picky about the place I stay but I surely felt like I'm at home in this hotel. I'm looking forward to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tpinet
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and our main reason for choosing it was its location. Not only a great location but very clean and great service too. The main lobby was extremely spacious with a piano, clean hallways, clean rooms and bathrooms. The actual room was well furnished with a comfortable king bed. Absolutely no complaints except for the food and drinks selection... We had a couple drinks at the bar but their draft beer selection is lacking (only Bud Light?!?!) so I went with the local Stone beer which was good. The breakfast wasn't bad but nothing to write home about. On the following days we just went to Coffee Bean Tea Leaf. We did not eat lunch or dinner there judging by the breakfast and we looked at a menu. Like I said above, location is everything. You are in walking distance to the Amtrak (which we took in), the bay, Horton Plaza, Gaslamps, Seaport village, basically everything. For anything else I would recommend the Old Town Trolley Tours to see the rest of the city. Highly recommended __IF__ you head over to the Gaslamps for food and drinks since there are plenty in that area!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and well appointed. Extremely comfortable bed. The architecture of this hotel is stunning. The staff is the best, ever. We had a problem with noisy neighbors and the staff was immediately responsive and took care of the situation. The lounge is a great place for a drink and a bite to eat. There is a discount for hotel guests. The breakfast is the best I've ever had. Try the vegetarian eggs benedict or the oatmeal with orange sugar brÃ»lÃ©e. Valet parking is half price if you drive a hybrid -- how cool is that! Speaking of cool, the location is great and the bus terminal referred to in some old reviews was torn down years ago. No noise problem from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. No amenities.”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveler22
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was frIendly. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were nice. The location at 1st and Broadway was perfect. Centrally located between the water, Gaslamp and Little Italy. Staying here would have been nicer if there was a pool, larger fitness facility and a place to sit outside and enjoy a beautiful San Diego evening. One of my favorite thing to do when visiting California is to relax around a fire pit and enjoy some cocktails. San Diego is a beautiful and very calm city. The Bristol overall was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hvanveen
Reviews.Content: Perfect location within walking distance of everything. We had trouble with the hot water - we either wouldn't get any or the shower would be hot then cold then hot again. The pocket doors to the bathroom weren't ideal and our view was of a wall (beside the elevator). Other than that this hotel was great. Front desk staff was fabulous and we received a call soon after we checked in to make sure the room was satisfactory. The lobby was beautiful and the free wifi in the room was a nice touch. We also received half off the dinner menu at the restaurant which was so great and a relief from otherwise high prices in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Get a room at the back!”
Reviews.Author: gtg308x
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for a VERY reasonable rate and loved its central location to the Gaslamp quarter. The room had been recently renovated, and after flying in that night from the east coast, I was glad to fall into a clean and cozy bed. There was a sorority holding a formal in the hotel, but management made sure to put all hotel patrons who were not part of that party on separate floors away from them. It was a very wise decision, as I know those dances can get rowdy. However, it was not those revelers that woke me up that night, but the Greyhound station across the street announcing the departure and arrival of buses. I am not a light sleeper, but it woke both my family and me up. In the morning, we requested a room on the other side of the hotel (the backside), and it was much quieter. I was not awoken (neither was anyone else) all night. If you get a room in the front, I would rate this hotel poor. If you get a room at the back, I would rate it very good.

Reviews.Title: “Central, chic, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: pccarmody
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in San Diego and couldn't afford the rates at the huge chain hotels downtown. I looked around for other places, and the Bristol was everything I was looking for. CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE: I talked to a real front desk employee when I called the reservations line. The decor is exquisite and charming. The staff is courteous and willing. I bothered them several times for early check in, various odds and ends that I had forgotten, directions to attractions, random pictures, etc. They were very patient and helpful. Their decor is modern, dynamic, and attractive--the property really does look as it appears on the website. Cleanliness is clearly a top priority at this property, down to small details--I returned after housekeeping not only to find that everything had been restored and restocked, but my housekeeper had actually arranged my toiletries on my countertop in a more visually pleasing array. I felt taken care of. I also had an emergency with my packed clothes getting stained on the flight over, but their same-day dry cleaning service had me covered. LOCATION: I never questioned my safety here, even when walking home at night, alone. Don't tempt the fates, of course, but The Bristol is secure. It is also very close to several remarkable restaurants and shopping centers--closer than a lot of the larger hotels, actually. If you need to save money like I did, you might find that walking is a real option here, with distances that won't leave you sore and out of breath. SUGGESTED IMPROVEMENTS: I would have liked a heads up on some of the events that were happening in town during my stay, like foot races, comedy shows, or live bands. But I don't see this being a big issue, a lot of folks probably come to San Diego with a full itinerary anyway. My main regret is that I couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay courtesy of Hotel Tonight”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Mission Bay but the taxi service was very expensive. Took a chance a booked via Hotel Tonight app. Couldn't have been more pleased. Hotel is well appointed with a nice restaurant and hip bar. The greatest ammenity was the front desk staff. They were pleasant and very helpful. Would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “good value , nine clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KingDin
Reviews.Content: We were looking at a few different places to stay and settled on Bistol because of the place. The room, were clean and modern. Valet parking is affordable at 26$ per 24 hours. If you are really on a budget you can find garage parking a few blocks away for $5 each time you come in and out. Honestly I dont even think you need your car. there is shopping and restaurants in walking distance and the Gaslamp district if a few min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized service in a downtown setting...”
Reviews.Author: lucyvp67
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful downtown, boutique hotel that offers personalized service and is 110% customer focused! They offer a variety of rooms and views, as well as a chic, yet comfy and welcoming restaurant and lounge. Unlike other 'big box' downtown hotels, the Bristol offers complimentary wifi and use of the business center. Their daily valet parking fee is competitive in the area, and allows unlimited in/out access at no extra fees. The staff is very knowledgeable of the San Diego area and are more than happy to assist with your questions and provide recommendations. Skip the 'big box/big boys' and head to the Bristol--you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, Front desk staff know a lot about San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ColoMandM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol for 3 nights and were very happy. It's in a great location. It's close to everything from fast food to fancy restaurants. The rooms are nice. The front desk staff are very knowledgeable about tourist activities in San Diego. During our stay, all hotel guests were entitled to 50% in the restaurant (food is good). There's a computer in the lobby with free internet access. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunDevilTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Bristol. It is very close to the Horton Plaza Mall and a short walk to the gaslamp district of San Diego. We had a room with two double beds. For the most part it seemed clean, but there was a paper that someone had written on left on the nighstand. This made us wonder just how well the room had really been cleaned. It was a small room as compared to other hotels with double beds that we have stayed at in San Diego before. The bathroom was also quite small, and the sink was clogged. It was good for a one night stay, but we will try somewhere else the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Heartily Endorsed by Rudy The Dog”
Reviews.Author: GoldilocksArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the Christmas Holidays at The Bristol. We made our plans at the last minute, and I was stressing to find a nice hotel that would allow us to bring our very large and well-behaved dog Rudy with us. Most hotels either did not allow any pets, or limited the pet to a very small size. The Bristol, a charming boutique hotel less than a block from Horton Plaza, had no objection and were, in fact, so friendly to Rudy The Dog that he looked forward to strolling through the elegant marble-floored lobby area near the desk staff. There is a small grassy area on the north side of the hotel property, across the trolley tracks, to walk your dog, and a convenient trash receptical sits at the corner. I brought plenty of doggy-bags which was a great idea, because none seemed to be offered anywhere. Our original reservation for four nights was lengthened to eight nights, which should tell you that we really enjoyed our stay. Our upgraded King Bed room ran 109 plus 26/night for valet parking (no self-park). With tax it totalled about 149/night plus daily tips for maid and valet. The other TA reviews do a good job of describing the hotel property, and I'll just add that our room was beautiful (sixth floor, northeast corner). Amenities include terry-robes in the closet, room service and friendly staff. The Greyhound terminal is across the street from the hotel on First Avenue, so street noise may have been less in our room, which faced the opposite direction. I would gladly recommend The Bristol to anyone looking for a beautiful boutique hotel, strategically located near so much to see and do, in the heart of San Diego. If you're bringing your four-legged friend, you should know that I walked Rudy from the hotel, through Balboa Park to a fantastic dog park with grass, trees, and a doggy-water-fountain. There is also a "dogs-allowed-off-leash" Dog Beach in Ocean Beach, a short drive away. Please note that we never left Rudy in the room by himself - so there was no issue of barking or disturbing other guests. If you bring your canine companion, please act responsibly so that great hotels like The Bristol will continue their Dog-Friendly policies. Thank you Bristol staff. Rudy says Woof.

Reviews.Title: “Coouldn't have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: BilingualTeacher
Reviews.Content: First time staying in San Diego other than the guest suites at my parents' condominium, and believe me--the best hotel I have ever stayed in in my life! I was completely blown away by the king sized bed, the fantastic coffee and candies, the TV (even got closed captions!) and-- the minute I put my head sown on the pillows of the dream bed, I was in dreamland! The decor is gorgeously tasteful and functiional--a dock in the lamp--wow! Centrally located- 2 blocks from my parents' house--EVERYTHING on Broadway and of course Westfield's Horton Plaza. UIn one word--SUPERCALIFRAGILISTICESPIALIDOCIOUS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great days!!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana Z
Reviews.Content: I went with my sister a month ago and I want to say that this hotel is really nice, have a very very great location. Only one thing, the bathroom's door wasnÂ´t able to be locked :( Great beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back to The Bristol :)”
Reviews.Author: LoveLaughEatLive
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, especially Ahmad at the front desk. Friendly, knowledgable, helpful. Just awesome. The room was slightly tight & difficult to move around, but the decore was gorgeous & we didn't really care because everything else was just great. The hotel is walking distance from everything: great food (I recommend Cafe 21), the Harbour with the Maritime & Midway museums, and if you're willing to walk a little further, to Little Italy. Yup. I'd do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior location, great service, just a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_in_DC
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome for getting to/from airport and public transportation, it was always easy to catch a cab or walk. The service was pleasant and rooms were clean. Only quirks: gym wasn't impressive and the bathroom had a pocket door that never entirely closed. If you're sharing a room with someone else, you may also be sharing the full sensory experience of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: redz81
Reviews.Content: We only spent 3 nights here, but wished we were here longer. Our room was on the 8th floor and was very very spacious. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Its very close to restaurants and shopping - all within walking distance. There are bus stops within a 2 minute walk that take you wherever you need. We went to Seaworld and the zoo using the bus. The hotel restaurant was excellent. We ate breakfast there each morning, and had dinner there once, it was never busy so im not sure how busy the hotel was, but we hardly saw anyone. I'm not sure if its all the time but hotel guests get 50% of the mains (except burgers). I ordered two mains because it tasted so good! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bristol Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trish20
Reviews.Content: A friend and I attended a convention in San Diego and stayed at the Bristol Hotel. It is stylish and elegant, located close to shopping and restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter, and the affordable rooms are modern and comfortable. It is a fairly easy walk to the convention center, which is refreshing after sitting in meetings all day. The restaurant menu is good, but there are tons of great restaurants in that part of town. Small, cute bar with great service. The only downside was not getting the room I requested (we got a king with a roll-away instead of 2 doubles) which was odd since I made the reservation in June, but we got some $1 glasses of wine for the inconvenience. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CdeSon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights because of a conference at the Convention Center. The location is great, a 10 minute walk to the convention center and near restaurants, pubs and shopping malls. The Gaslamp is a very lively area. Nice quiet room and very friendfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy A
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying here at Bristol Hotel. I must say that the location of this hotel is perfect for me. It is nice and clean, the price is affordable. It is near bars, restaurants and shops in Gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “We walked from Bristol Hotel to mall in 3 mins.”
Reviews.Author: MrSL0TS
Reviews.Content: Another quality choice provided by Hotel Tonight. Rate was great & I will once again invite all of you with smartphones to download the Hotel Tonight App. Enter this invite code on the app for your $25 in credits: dstanert Then you will immediately be able to use your credit towards bookings & after your stay, the app will provide you with more credits after a brief survey. Can't beat this app! We have stayed at many hotels in downtown San Diego. Both Gaslamp & Bristol. Both are clean, friendly & within walking of stores/restaurants Really within walking. No need to drive. Both hotels have paid parking& never had a problem with tampering of our car. I will also post my review for the Porto Vista Hotel soon. Sadly, we had some concerns there.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lkb925
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Bristol every time we visit San Diegio. Have always had a postive experience. The hotel is within easy walking distance of several attractions and the waterfront. They offer valet parking for 29.00 per night. On par with the rest of the hotels in the area. The staff is always pleasant and accommodating. The price of the rooms are reasonable for downtown San Diego. The rooms are a generous size. The hotel is clean and quiet. Beds are comfortable. The restaurant on site is adequate. WiFi is complementary. There is no pool. The fitness room is tiny and consists of two pieces of exercise equipment. If this is an issue for someone might want to look else where. For our needs, the Bristol is more than we could ask for considering the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern, comfy, and nearby to downtown sights”
Reviews.Author: NuadaSilverHand
Reviews.Content: We only stayted at the hotel for a single night. It is very convenient to Gaslamp district and easy walking to Seaport Village, Convention Center etc. Of course, along with proxmity to the Gaslamp district you also have to deal with the homeless, people partying hard, and so forth. Goes with the territory. A nice lobby, a touch of retro/modern, greets you. The people at the front desk were cheerful and helpful. We got upgraded to a larger room, on the "quiet side" of the hotel (not facing Broadway). The room was large, with a separate office area, a big 52" LCD, in a design that I will term retro/modern again. All was clean. The bathroom could use a touch of spiffing up but there was nothing dirty. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant (we were in a hurry) - nothing special, merely adequate...but in general, there are so many restaurants in the area it is no big deal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out well”
Reviews.Author: Gotravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. I really liked this hotel. It was clean, neat and well maintained. It was close to the Gaslamp district for good meals, it was a short walk to the harbor and it was a short trolley ride to Old Town. We were also able to catch a bus to Coronado at the corner. The drawbacks were few, but the bus announcements early in the morning (Greyhound is across the street) bothered my friend and on the weekend the drunks and homeless panhandlers were plentiful. Also, we asked (at the front desk) for an early wake up call our last morning to catch an early morning flight and we didn't get one. Luckily, I set a back up on my travel alarm so we were okay.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place”
Reviews.Author: riflemn
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Bristol hotel. This was our second visit in two years to the Bristol. We love the location downtown as it is handy for everything, including shopping, Gas town, Little Italy, and the waterfront. You can walk to all these locations and don't need a car. Our room was spacious, immaculate and very modern with all the amenities. Our king bed was very comfortable with great pillows and linens As with most locations downtown you do get some street noise, but nothing that disturbed us. There was a little room in the stocked bar for some of our personal items, like water and coke which was helpful. The staff both at the front counter and in the dining room were friendly to deal with and very helpful. They all go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The food in the dining room is always excellent and better than any place we tried in Gas Town I am always amazed more people don't eat there. I would suggest they lower the price of their coffee as I think it scares away some breakfast trade. The interior of the hotel is kept spotless all the time and the have a free computer in the lobby for guests . We always felt safe walking in the downtown, Gas town area as there is always lots of people around. If we are back in San Diego we will be returning to the Bristol as the place where we feel welcome. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasthere78
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay here , it is a very nice , typical 'business/corporate' hotel . Rooms very nice, good location - easily walkable to seafront/ harbour area , gas lamp quarter , little Italy and balboa park for zoo etc . Only draw back is it doesn't include any form of breakfast, not even token cookies/pastries which some other similar hotels do, and also the valet parking of a steep $26 a day - both of which obviously adds to the overall cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: uplandbabs
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with superior service, including reservations, desk, valet, and restaurant staff. Great room with lots of ammenities and a comfy bed. Enjoyed the bar and restaurant and the incentives to use both. And very convenient for work and pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cap4Auckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the location very good. The homeless people can be a little intimidating (especially for children) but didn't cause us any bother. Parking is expensive at $26 per day. The room was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but loud.”
Reviews.Author: TerriandDave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a nice stay at the Bristol, but after requesting a quiet room months in advance, I was very disappointed to see that we were right across from the bus station. My husband thought that maybe that was the "quiet side", but I can't imagine that is was. The bed was quite uncomfortable, along with the pillows, so it was really hard to get a good night's sleep. The front desk staff were very sweet, almost to a fault. As a group of guys were loudly gathering for a night on the town in the lobby, drinking out of Solo cups and playing the piano, the front desk seemed too meek to intervene. It just made the hotel look more like a frat house and less of a classy downtown hotel, that I know it has the potential to be. The room was clean, location was nice and the front desk and room service staff were very friendly, but I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCB33
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Bristol hotel. The room was modern and clean, staff were pleasant and helpful. The location was good, within walking distance to restaurants and shops. We used the hotel's valet parking, although somewhat expensive, the service was fantastic. A great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: navid r
Reviews.Content: Close to GasLamp and all restaurants in the area. Staff were friendly and helpful with directions and day planing advice. Room was spacious with a king bed. Fitness room is very small, but equipment is good.

Reviews.Title: “Surrey traveller”
Reviews.Author: SurryVisitor100
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights whilst exploring local attractions. It was very well located (as other reviewers have mentioned) with ease of access to the freeway and for exploring on foot, but what was really special about this hotel were the decor (our room was lovely in red/white/black) and the helpfulness of the staff at the front desk. Oh, and the 'Bristol Parfait' at breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in town for a conference.The location was great, within walking distance from the convention center. There was also an outdoor shopping mall down the street. The rooms were clean and modern. A computer is in the lobby, for printing boarding passes. There is also free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: amksba
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for one night in early June while in town to see a musical. The hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of the musical (two blocks) and also within walking distance of the fun Gaslamp district, where we had dinner and shopped after the show. The room was perfect and we loved our stay. On the way out, I even saw that they allow pets - we'll definitely consider staying here again! Valet parking is a bit pricey, so try to book a room with it included.

Reviews.Title: “Catering at Bristol Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth R
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding reception was held at the Bristol Hotel 9th floor. The reception area was great, as was the food, but watch your wallet when it's over! The catering company they use, Festivities, was less than spectacular. The bartender charged 4 different prices for the same drinks (all of them over the contacted price!), and I was never given a bar tab at the end of the evening. They didn't keep track of how much wine we brought for corkage fee purposes, and I kept having to badger them for answers to my questions. I finally had to contact the president of the company to get results. You're on your own if you use this catering company at the Bristol.

Reviews.Title: “High standard, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Pekkster
Reviews.Content: Location is ok, valet parking. Service good. Breakfast I dont recommend. Rooms ok. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: burbs04
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for several reasons, 1- location - close to all attractions including the gas lamp quarter which is fab at night with wonderful resturants and bars. 2 - Service - the service at the hotel i could not fault, it was clean and tidy and the staff where very intentive 3 - Value for your money - although remember that parking in large city does come at a cost and this was around $12 per day at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “BEEP BEEP BEEP... All I heard.”
Reviews.Author: shaunaheinicke
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the prices were very reasonable for a 3 night stay in downtown SD. The hotel was nice and modern - though I think you could "modernize" any hotel with the right bed spread and wallpaper. The positive things included a friendly staff, close proximity to public transit as well as Gaslamp [a short walk of only a couple blocks], big windows, and a well-stocked honor [woo hoo!] mini bar. The negatives were the noise and an uncomfortable bed, and cramped tub. There is a bus station right across the street and if you like to sleep with the windows open like I do, you will be woken up constantly from 4am on, by the non-stop clamor of buses - beeping, clanging, engines, oh my. We didn't sleep very well until we gave in on the third night - closed the windows and ran the A/C instead. The bed was uncomfortable for me [and I'm not picky] - the mattress was too firm, and the pillows were the kind that are so squishy-soft that your head sinks through them with no support.The bathtub is also one of those teasers with the slanted back begging you to lay back, if only the tub wasn't so close to the wall that there's nowhere to put your neck and head. Now that's torture, especially after you've hit the mini bar. We ordered a lot of room service from the Daisy cafe downstairs and the food was mostly very good, though not many light/fresh breakfast options [mostly different versions of eggs and potatoes]. But the Irish Cream[?] Cheesecake was phenomenal. Also, the hotel requests that you leave your recyclables out of the room trash can which, I appreciate, but it would be nice if they provided and alternate bin so the trash is not just sitting around everywhere. Also Also, [Bristol, if you're listening] if you're going to be earth-conscious enough to recycle, then why do you put little [non-recyclable] laminated cards in each room every day with the days weather on it? I think most of us can access the internet, and at the very least can see through our windows. Sadly, I don't think I will stay here again. Vacation is for relaxing, and discomfort + noise = peace-killer.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room”
Reviews.Author: paleITA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bristol just for one night, the room was really nice, large and comfortable with every thing we needed and expected. The only complain is about the bathroom door which was sliding and did not actually close the room.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and great value in the centre of San Diego with parking included!”
Reviews.Author: BarrieLV
Reviews.Content: We chose the Bristol Hotel for our two nights in San Diego based on the reviews in Trip Advisor and were delighted with our stay. The package we booked included parking, breakfast and free wifi and was excellent value for downtown. The staff could not be nicer, from the valet parking to the reception to the bar and the breakfast, they were always friendly, helpful and gave great service. Our room was stylish and comfortable and well equipped. The location was perfect for buying our bus passes (great value) and catching buses to everywhere we wanted to go, and for walking to the Gaslamp district for dinner and to the harbour for boat tours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not sure about management”
Reviews.Author: highlatte
Reviews.Content: First, the positive. This was a very clean, contemporay boutique hotel. Rooms were a bit smaller then expected, but nicely decorated. Attractive bar and the usual hotel restaraunt food. Location.....fantastic. The trolley is right around the corner and a short walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. Pet friendly....no extra charge for your pooches. The negative. Waitstaff in restaraunt could be friendlier (morning Shift) Booked a deal online. Even called the hotel direct to book and told had to book online to get the deal. Back to Internet. When we arrived, they would not honor our online booking. Had to wait to speak to mgmnt next day. Was told " could not give us the deal booked". Could not? Did someone have a gun to the owners or management's head?. Ridiculous. More like "would not". Bottom line we paid more for our room and lost out on part of the package (gift certificate for $25 for each nites stay, we got two instead of four for the four nites we stayed). Very petty and poor business practice. Left a very bad taste. This could have been four stars but for bad faith.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Staff, Surprisingly Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JGCoyote
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice this year, once in January and once in August and both times the weather was a revelation compared to my native Chicago... This is a wonderful hotel with an unpromising facade on a stretch of street that can look a little dodgy. Not only is it safe, it is extremely convenient. You can pick up a pass for the trolley on the corner (single or multi-day passes). The trolley stop is just around the block. If you are in town for a conference at the Convention Center, it couldn't be easier. If you like malls, there's a big one a few blocks away. I don't, but you can cut through it to get to the more interesting Gaslamp district. The staff at the Bristol couldn't be more helpful. I have been lucky both times and upgraded to very nice rooms. Spacious. Enough outlets to recharge everything I haul around. Good bed. Clean bathroom. Good shower. Robes. And since I'm not in the room during the day and have the curtains pulled at night, who cares what the view is? (a bus station...) Bonus tip: Ask about the St. Tropez cafe about a block away. GREAT place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: polobear99
Reviews.Content: The room was huge and nicely appointed. The location was perfect next to shopping and restaurants and within easy walking distance to all the downtown hot spots. A welcomed change from the big hotel chains. We would stay there again on our next visit to the area.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cajodo
Reviews.Content: The Bristol was delightful in all respects. The decor is contemporary and very current; the rooms are spacious and clean. Daisy's bartender is friendly and breakfast was tasty. The location was excellent in that it's not really in the Gaslamp District's noise, but close enough to walk to for dinner. Highly recommend; can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Worst. Service. Ever. Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler51573
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Bristol for a high school reunion being held in their ball room. Not only was it my reunion, but also the first night away from our precious newborn son, we were looking forward to a night away and sleeping in for the first time in four months! :) Both the ball room and our hotel room were nice enough, but the customer service was appalling. As it was our 20th reunion and we were seeing friends we had not seen in years we were told about the hotels "no party policy", but told we would be able to socialize as late as we like in the hotel lobby as it was two floors below the nearest hotel room. And just to clarify "socialize", I was giggling with old girlfriends while sitting on a couch in the lobby, not yelling, screaming and running up and down the halls. After following these guidelines, and catching up with friends in the lobby as requested, I returned to my hotel room (where my husband was sound asleep) to a party being broken up by security across the hall. I entered my room only to receive a knock on the door moments later by a security guard saying we were being evicted. When I asked why, she said she had received complaints about a party in our room. When I invited her in to see that my husband was sleeping and had been for hours and that I was just returning from the lobby, she said it didn't matter and left. Within an hour two police were knocking on our door to evict us!!! When we asked for an explanation we were told they could evict whomever they chose for any reason and they did not need to give an explanation. Really?!?!?! When we asked for their names, they refused to give them, which to me is an automatic admission of fault. The worst part is that the group having the party across the hall, also alumni, had received multiple visits from security and we later found out they were not evicted. We chose to wait a day to contact administration to cool off a bit, as we were understandably upset. The way the situation was handled by the management was equally, if not more appalling. We were hung up upon by management on our first call, the administrative assistant at the main office refused to give us the email of the president, as the one online was no longer valid, and when we finally received a response by those in upper management, we were threatened not to post a review in travel blogs. So....I am taking a risk by writing this review, but advise potential guests to stay at their own risk.....you, too may receive a knock on your door to be evicted for no reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the chain experience in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: Was in the mood for something a little different when attending a conference at the convention center and this seemed to fit the bill. Location is good; about a 20 minute walk to the convention center (though I'd probably take a cab after dark). Horton Center is a block away. The light rail is also about a block or so away. And an inexpensive cab ride from the airport (less than $20). Better than the location is the hotel. Great room. Not too big, not too small. Stylish decor, Extremely comfortable bed,. Functional desk. Modern electronics (flat screen TV, a iPod recharger-alarm clock that I never figured out how to operate, opting instead for wake up calls). Comfortable bathroom and great towels. Mini-bar but could put other stuff in the refrigerator if you wanted to. Nice lobby. Polite staff. Even though I didn't have much time to really see San Diego, because I stayed here, I felt like I experienced a little bit of it, rather than just having had gone to the conference. I don't think I would have felt that way had I stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review on the Bristol”
Reviews.Author: TravelAlotCA
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and we decided to stay here on our last night in the area, so we could be downtown to go to a Padres games. As previous reviewers said - the area is seedy. Lots of homeless and a kind of deserted feel around. The staff is really nice - all of them. Once you are in the hotel it is nice - decent rooms and nice lobby. The main issue we had (aside from the seedy area, but we knew that going in) is that they have events on weekends - like HS reunions! We were there last night (Saturday) and there was a 20th HS reunion going on. All the rooms around us were partying loudly. The really unfortunate situation was that there were 3 rooms all around us (oh, and we have a 9 yr old) who partied, drank and cursed really loudly all night! Finally we were awoken at 5:30am by the idiot next to us SCREAMING the worst curses. As we prepared to leave, the police came and evicted the couple who were causing this problem. Obviously this was really unnacceptable and the hotel comped us our room. The manager was very, very nice and sorry. So on the one hand, the Bristol was great in treating us well, but the downside is that they seem to host a lot of party people (see previous commenters). I guess if you want to stay here, ask for a room not near any reunion or wedding party members!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Gunbies
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on Independance Day expecting only a skeleton staff. Couldn't have been further from the truth. Staff very attentive and prompt. Location of hotel is ideal for walking out to the Westfield Centre, about 1 minute and the Gaslamp Quarter about 3 minutes. Local transportation in easy walking distance if you don't want a car.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, some good things, some bad”
Reviews.Author: snoopy79
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Bristol Hotel we were pleased, the hotel looked lovely and was in a very central location. When we got to our room around 6pm we could hear the people next door. I don't mean a conversation, full on partying, shouting, screaming. So I immediately asked for a new room. This was done with no problem at all but I was told this wasn't a party hotel so they couldn't do anything about noise at 6pm. I totally understand that but if that was the noise at 6pm then what happens next?! Also the party hotel line made me laugh as someone had put posters up in the lift saying Party Reunion 9th floor. We moved rooms and it was silent until 2am when the party continued outside our hotel room. We took it into our own hands to tell them to be quiet. So it wasn't a party hotel..... Anyway, everything was fine until our final night. We had an early flight so were eager to get a good night's rest. At around 12.30am we were awoken by water and the sound of drips. There was streams of water coming through the ceiling on to us and the floor. The bathroom was soaked with water and the bedroom was on its way. We called the staff and they began to sort things out. Apparently upstairs had left their shower on. (not a party hotel though....) and we were to be moved to a smoking room. Strange has this was a non smoking hotel? Ah said reception, the person had smoked in it and couldn't get rid of the smell yet. (not a party hotel though) So after our room was flooded, through no fault of ours we should be moved to some stinky room? Ehh what? Eventually they found another room and it didn't smell. We could once again hear the person next door and we worked out that any room with an adjoining room allows you to hear every little sound. This new room was also next to the ice machine so we got very little sleep that night. The next day we were given our bill for valet asked about our stay - reception seemed oblivious to what had happened. When we explained we presumed that we would be offered something, free valet parking, free breakfast, something - no. An apology. So when our valet bill was presented to us I asked if we could get that taken off. We were given more than that off, just about $50 which was fine. I just wanted a token at that point but in hindsight I should have pushed. It was disappointing that it was very much of a case of don't ask don't get. In any hotel I've stayed in before they have always offered remunerations to make up for something that went wrong - a flooded room certainly deserved more than an apology. Would I go back? Nope. Should you go? possibly, but ask for a room without an adjoining room for a bit more peace and quiet. It was a comfortable bed, a very clean hotel but I'm concerned that people are flooding rooms, smoking in bedrooms, having parties on the 9th floor, and waking people up with screaming and shouting in the corridors at 2am. It's not a party hotel though.....

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingus1975
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, in a great location, with wonderful service. The hotel was spotlessly clean. The bathrooms were a bit small; but overall I enjoyed our room. It didn't have that neutral "hotel look" that many rooms have. I would stay again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: flaca21
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in San Diego and this hotel and its staff made it just perfect! You can't beat the location - everything is in walking distance or a short trolley ride. While staying there we visited Piers, Seaport Village, Gaslamp, Old Town, Balboa Park and the Zoo, Little Italy and we didn't even need a car! A short Ferry ride will take you to Coronado Island. The Britstol turned out to be a perfect fit for us - clean, quiet, simple boutique style hotel and friendly and helpful staff. Marcia(I apologize if I didn't get the name correctly) greeted us in the morning, she stored our bags and gave walking directions to Embarcadero. Ahmad was at the desk when we came back later that evening. He checked us in and was a big helper during both days we stayed there. Ahmad gave us directions to Old Town and showed how to use trolley. He was on duty every time we'd come into the lobby and answered all our questions. He also presented us with complimentary drink coupons which we used in the bar before going to bed. The room was a good size, clean and nicely decorated. There were all necessary amenities including minibar which we didn't use. The view from our window was of a Greyhound station but we haven't heard any street noise at all. The best feature probably was a good working A/C as it was very hot in SD that week. On the departure day they put a bill under your door before check out so you can review it. We greatly enjoyed our stay and would love to be back during our next San Diego trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: PalteseFalcon
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as my Brother was getting married in San Diego. All our famlily and friends stayed here and we can't fault the place. The staff were excellent and, in particular, the bar staff were incredibly accomodating and the whole experience here was brilliant. The hotel and the rooms are very clean (always a concern!). Room was a good size and the bathroom was perfect. It is in an ideal location for downtown San Diego and a short walk to the water. In addition, the prices were extremely competitive. All in all would recommend The Bristol for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Monique02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bristol for 2 nights in june 2011. We loved it! The staff at the frontdesk was very friendly and helpfull. The room was great. It was nicely decorated, fresh, clean, quiet and had everything we needed. LCD TV, fully stocked mini bar, desk, 2 chairs and a table, docking station for your Ipod, a safe, free WiFi and a huge, comfortatble King bed. The bathroom was spacious too, clean and had everything you wished for, like bathrobes and all the amenities you want. Breakfast at the hotel was very good. If you want you could go out for breakfast. There are plenty of other choices in the area of the hotel. If we will go back to San Diego, we will defenitely stay at the Bristol again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to see here, carry on.”
Reviews.Author: hfmstretch
Reviews.Content: Pretty much a place for the wife and I to crash as we spent most of our evening on the town. At check in the reception was nice. From the exterior the hotel seems drab and old but upon entry it was quite bright and contemporary. Not much space, the footprint of this hotel is relatively small and the lack of a pool and gym made this hotel a bare-bones experience. The parking really gives you heartache as the structure is very tight - even the valet drivers we saw had some difficulty. We expected to be able to sleep in but were unfortunately rudely awoken by the live band that set up shop as part of some urban marathon happening in gaslamp- complete BUMMER and totally annoying. Front desk did not seem to care, offering nothing to solace our disappointment. In fact, they said "we were not aware that a live band would be performing..." Such BS - own up! And if they didnt know, why not show a little sympathy and offer your guest a complimentary breakfast or something since we were up that early on a sunday (6:30am). If I wanted to wake that early, I would have stayed home so my kids could do the waking. Sheesh!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishRick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business. Excellent downtown location, right next to the San Diego Trolley line (stop is 1 block away). Hotel is within walking distance to the Horton Plaza, City Hall and the Gaslamp District. Well appointed large rooms in a black & white motif. Rooms include a large flatscreen TV and a desk. Rooms have an oversized safe that will hold a laptop. Wi-fi is included. Hotel has an adjoining restaurant & bar, but there is a huge selection in the Gaslamp District, only a 5-10 minute walk. Only downsides are parking ($26 per night) and the fact that the hotel faces the Greyhound Bus Depot, which gets a bit noisy. But, for the rates and the location, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlipfloppinGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on a vacation to San Diego, great location, friendly staff, nice clean rooms with free wifi. Down side-- There is no breakfast included and no pool. Also note - parking is $26 a night, but that seems average for the area. The complimentary beverage on arrival is a nice touch though. The hotel is located just north and west of the Gaslamp quarter and in walking distance of the mall at Horton Plaza. For the price it is a great place to stay if you want to be in the city, and in a relatively safe area with lots of restaurants and clubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel it make my two dogs smile”
Reviews.Author: ch0pnck
Reviews.Content: The Bristol hotel are a very friendly pet hotel.the staff was courteous and professional. The room was a decent size, nice, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, excelent location!”
Reviews.Author: vinivito
Reviews.Content: The room is very spacious, clean, friendly staff and awesome location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff but location a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: mplsben
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a deluxe room and it was very nice with 5-star amenities. King bed was comfortable with many pillows provided. Stayed 4 nights and both day and night staff were friendly and helpful. Also, liked stopping in the intimate bar for a nightcap. Location was a pleasant 10-minute walk to convention center. We had an early flight and hotel arranged a town car for same price as a taxi. In-room free wifi worked as expected. That's always a welcome relief! Negatives: my coworker tried the exercise room and said it was small and hot; hotel is across the street from bus station and street-facing rooms are a bit noisy. I enjoyed the 1 mile walk to convention center but some people might prefer a closer hotel. Our group of 4 saved hundreds of dollars by avoiding those hotels. I hate to mention this minor nusiance but the TV remote is very confusing to use--one of the most confusing of any hotel TV I've used. Never figured out how to get an onscreen channel guide or set sleep mode. It was even confusing to just turn the set on and off. (This sounds minor, I know, but it was frustrating.)

Reviews.Title: “Great room easy access to gas lamp fun”
Reviews.Author: khonkaen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights while in town for a conference. Let's start with positive and work our way down. Rooms were great. I stayed in a king deluxe. The room was large clean and very sleek. The bed and pillows very comfortable and the windows do open so fresh cool air is always available. Bathrooms are also nice and contain a very roomy shower. Down side to the rooms are that since the hotel is across the street from the greyhound station, there can be a lot of noise. That being said te rooms which are the most important consideration one makes when choosing a hotel are comfortable and a good value. The hotel is overall very clean. Down side to this establishment is that there is very little available in terms of service. There are no bellman to assist with bags. I also noticed that the front desk attendant would sometimes be absent leaving a cue of people awaiting their return. The gym is lacking. There are a couple of cardio machines as well as a muti use weight machine. There should be more dumbbells and more machines to make this gym more user friendly. Since three people were already there working out I was unable to do as all machines were in use.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a nice place, great location near Gaslamp Quarter and Horton Plaza”
Reviews.Author: ElleEmBee
Reviews.Content: The location was great - convenient to Gaslamp Quarter, Horton Plaza and to buses, comfortable walking distance to the waterfront. The room was a decent size, nice, clean and comfortable. They have a town car available which we used to get to the rental car pick-up, which is almost back at the airport. I was expecting that to cost us at least $15 but it was only $8 plus tip. (Driver was very friendly too!) The only negative was that there was a prom being held on the floor above us which was pretty loud and went until midnight-ish. They did warn us... but only after we were already checked in and given a room.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: itsmarie
Reviews.Content: I was actually really excited to stay here- seemed like a cool boutique hotel in a good spot. Well, the area its in is 'ok', within walking distance to the water and the ferry. Close to the highway too if you have to drive in which is convenient. The lobby was really nice and the staff was great and helpful. The room however was another story. Its teenie, which I guess is fine, but also not that great. The bathroom door was on a slider and it fell off the track- so we spent like 10 minutes trying to figure out how to hook it back up. I personally don't even know why they bothered with a door because it doesn't create a seal, you can hear the person your staying with use the bathroom. The bathroom too seemed really outdated and really small- and the towel rack was put on the wall crooked. The only thing I liked about it was that they had some eco features like half/full flush choice to conserve water. The room also smelled like food and the smell would not go away. It stunk. Plus, the heat would turn on full blast even when we had the AC 'on'. Very strange. And the view was a huge concrete wall from the next building. Nothing that splendid. We could also hear the people above us in their room, the ceiling seemed really low. Also, I know we are in the city, but parking was $26 for one day. Seems kind of crazy especially if your a guest at the hotel. Probably won't visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDC
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of the reviews and the rates. Got a huge room at the back of the hotel, which was great. Wonderful bed and decor. Had a conference at the Hyatt but didn't want to pay the expensive rates. Got the breakfast package, which was a perfect way to start the day and then take a quick walk to the conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant choice in San Diego, great rooms and an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ScottJM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute booking for us. Great price for its location, which is right in the heart of everything and close to the main areas of restaurants and nightlife. The rooms are excellent, brand new, clean and modern - brilliant, friendly check-in service when we arrived and a nice touch with the courtesy call to check everything was OK with the room. Overall, we had a great night here and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely return...”
Reviews.Author: wahine_kine
Reviews.Content: From the time I valet the car, to the front desk, to when I arrived in the room, the staff was courteous and professional. They offered maps around the city and even called into the room to see if I felt everything was to my liking, upon arrival. Even though I didn't have time to take advantage of it, I liked how there was a complimentary drink at the bar, as part of the welcome. And it was nice to have free Wi-fi in the room, also. The room was very nice and spacious. Loved the bed--soooooo comfy and the bathroom was nice, also. Bristol is about a couple of blocks north to the heart of Gaslamp so you can walk to Gaslamp, have fun, and walk back to Bristol, no problem... Horton shopping center is close, too. The ocean, freeway access, and the airport is conveniently close to Bristol. If ever I return to Diego to party at Gaslamp, I would definitely make it a weekend and book a room here, 'cause of its convenience to everything. A weekend getaway would be perfect here, also...

Reviews.Title: “Not Pet-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: OCLA
Reviews.Content: The service I experienced was the worse service I've ever experienced from a Front Desk Concierge ever. My first day there I received a call that my dog was barking when in fact she wasn't. It was another dog on that floor. Then the next day after completing the San Diego Rock n Roll Half Marathon and relaxing in my room. I received another call about my dog barking. This time it's true she was barking. But to her defense she was barking because the maid was outside of our room cleaning other rooms. But it was never a constant bark. So I went downstairs to explain this to the front desk concierge and she was rude to me. She said she was rude because I was being sarcastic. I know no one wants to hear a yapping dog all hours of the day but to even get calls that she's barking is a bit too much. I am a guest too. And the hotel says Pet-Friendly yet every time a dog barks everyone with dogs are called and told that someone is complaining about a dog. Why put the dogs on one designated floor and even entertain calls about barking dogs. I feel like the other guest should be told that the floor they'll be staying on has dogs and there will be occasional dog barks. To me it's like someone complaining about hearing a baby crying. So I didn't feel comfortable and I did not feel welcomed at all. I was about to leave early and drive back to L.A. even though I was sore from running. I can't say my stay was great because that really put me in a sour mood. I never received complaints about my dog before and she's stayed in other hotels. And I've never been talked to like that before from a Front Desk Attendant. The rooms are Ok. I had to call the Front Desk to send up a plunger cause the toilet almost overflowed. The toilet also leaked throughout our stay. The rugs look like rugs in Las Vegas casinos. The flat screen TV's are not hooked up properly. The quality is poor. Maybe it's not hooked up to an HDMI cable. It's located right outside a Greyhound station. There is no parking outside but the hotel has parking but you have to pay $26 dollars per day for Valet. I did like the fact that there was free WIFI. It was close to the MTA station. And the bellhop guy was great. He helped us bring all our stuff up to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: lumamarx
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with The Bristol, we arrived late from Los Angeles and were delighted to be treated to upgrades on both of the rooms we had booked. The receptionist (I think her name was Corrine) was really helpful and explained the area to us and where would be good to eat. The hotel was in a great area and the rooms were wonderful with the most comfortable beds we stayed in on our whole trip (out of 7 hotels!). Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Bristol Hotel in San Diego was one I will remember for a lifetime.”
Reviews.Author: Nikolisarel
Reviews.Content: The first impression of a hotel is everything. Not only did Bristol exceed my expectations, but the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. My favorite part of our trip was the hotel bartender, Bob. He was the nicest guy, and gave us so many tips on cool locations to visit that only the locals really know about. Thanks Bob!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, funky, modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: isaiahkelly
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is in the perfect location in Downtown San Diego and three nights were not enough. Check in was a breeze, even when we arrived a little early. The room was decorated very modern, i just loved the black, white, and red colour scheme. A lovely big king bed with lots of cushions and the room was quite large for being right in the heart of the city. Our room faced the Greyhound bus depot but we rarely heard them. The welcome drink voucher was also a pleasant surprise. It was a block walk to Westfields for shopping and dining, we took a tour bus of the city from here also. The Bristol is only two blocks away from the Gaslamp Quarter. We enjoyed dinner here two nights, itâ€™s way too hard to pick a restaurant out of so many- spoilt for choices! It felt very safe walking back to the Bristol from Gaslamp even very late at night. And you do need a short stroll to walk off such a delicious dinner! Right around the corner was the bus stop to San Diego Zoo ( a must see!) , very easy to find on our own. I highly recommend the Bristol for location to Gaslamp Quarter dining and easy public transport to other San diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Tinribbs
Reviews.Content: I've travelled extensively over the last 10 years, to the point where hotels generally become much of a muchness. It was so nice, therefore, to have a really stand out, pleasant experience staying at The Bristol. Right from the minute we walked into the hotel, we were greeted with such a warm welcome from Ahmar / Amir (Sorry I never was any good with names) and he immediately made us feel at home there. He gave us some great tips on where to go locally (as we were only there for 1 night), and despite our short stay, nothing was too much trouble. Especially thanks for the tip on the tasting selection of drinks at the local brewhouse. I hope your next employee of the month award comes soon (he never asked me to say that - Honest!!). Our room was excellent, and the hotel was in a great location close to all the great bars and restaurants around 3rd, 4th and 5th street. Breakfast wasn't included, but we ate at the hotel anyway, and it was excellent. As I said above, I couldn't fault it, but what gave the place the elusive 5 star review was the little extras they did for you, above and beyond the normal service. Printing off maps, and instructions on how to get to Old Town and recommending one of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever been to. As well as simple things like leaving a small card in the car, with some good suggestions of local radio stations. This felt like a 5 star hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. San Diego, and this hotel, were one of the highlights of a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Bristol is a great hotel in a central location in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: chippochic
Reviews.Content: San Diego is a lovely destination. My daughter and I took the train from LA to San Diego. Good trip, some of it along the coastline with sea views. 2 1/2 hours and reasonably priced. We chose The Bristol from the internet in LA and booked online. The staff are courteous and helpful. Evidently the owner is an Aussie. There is an Australian flag flying outside. The room was good, clean and two beds. Had a fabulous illuminated magnified mirror in the bathroom! There wasn't a full length mirror in the room but we were opposite the lifts and there was one on the wall there so we just opened the room door. The bathroom was clean but dated. The shower was above the bath which is a bit tricky to negotiate. The windows opened which was good. There was a glimpse of the water through the buildings opposite. The hotel is well located. The trolley runs from the top of the block on C street. It is a block from the Horton Plaza for shopping. Close to the restaurants of the Gaslamp Quarter. The blocks in San Diego are a quarter of the size of normal US city blocks so it is a very walking friendly city. Take the hop on hop off tour of the city which takes you our to Coronado Island and Balboa Park where the San Diego Zoo is and up to Old Town and Little Italy. If you get Captain Bob on one of the legs of your tour you will have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!! The staff were outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: WolfingOn
Reviews.Content: We found a consistenly high level of customer service in most places we visited in the US and the staff at the Bristol Hotel topped the list. They spoke passionately about the hotel and the city and were extremely helpful whenever we required advice and direction. The rooms were excellent, very clean, comfortable and modern and the rest of the hotel was presented in the same way. The location is well placed between the Gaslamp District and Harborside area, although both are a reasonable walk away. Overall we had a fantastic experience, thanks primarily to the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff and would definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: bncav
Reviews.Content: The best I can say about this hotel is LOCATION. Very convenient, one block away from a shopping mall, less than 10 minutes walking from the Convention Center, and for those driving, in a short distance from the highways linking Downtown to any other place worth visiting. The rooms are good in size and comfort. The downside is the free internet, which is not stable and quite slow. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful, providing all the information I needed. The $26 for parking is expensive, but comparable to other hotels in Downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for a good hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mpmeara
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased during my wife's recent trip to the ACP. Instead of paying hundreds of dollars more to stay at the conference sponsored hotels, we found this gem which was in the same locations as the others. The hotel staff was attentive to our needs, even though we had the unfortunate luck of being roomed across the hall from a bachelor party the final night. All in all, I certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: linmcmlln
Reviews.Content: Bristol Hotel is ideally located between the Gaslamp District and the San Diego harbor attractions. The room was very clean and attractive, the desk staff exceptionally friendly. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant (Daisy's Bistro) and found the food quite good. Overall, an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: PAsawyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bristol before and after a recent cruise. The price was very reasonable, and after seeing the room, it is larger than many other hotels in this price category. The bathroom was a little small, but how much time do you spend there? Rooms were clean and its smoke free. The staff was very amenable to any requests. They gave good directions, and were always willing to chat, if they had time. A good restaurant is on site, if you chose to dine in. They have a computer in the lobby for guests. Good for checking email or booking your flight. Location, location, location. Its only about 6 blocks to the cruise dock and marina. It can easily be walked in about 10 minutes. Its a few blocks from the Gaslight district and the downtown mall. A bus stop is at the corner, and you can get to other San Diego attractions from there. We went to the Zoo. Need a cab? They had a private one waiting for us early in the morning to take us to the airport. Not really a cab, more like a limo. If I'm in San Diego again, I'll be using the Bristol.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. Hotel is very nice. I am VERY picky about hotels and where to stay when on vacation but this one meet my expectations. Nice size room, bathroom, bed, closet, etc. Hotel is in a great location, a few min walk to Horton Plaza and everywhere else downtown. Only downfall is that the Greyhound station is right across so we could hear the loud speaker quite often. I always wish the hotel would have had some better TV channels. I would defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled with care”
Reviews.Author: Advisor415
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Convenient to Gaslamp Quarter and Bus Station, just a quick drive from museums & zoo -Caring staff, really wanted us to enjoy our stay and post our review on the web -Reasonable room pricing -Special packages, we got the Zoo package and enjoyed a day at the San Diego Zoo following -Complimentary breakfast that they will deliver as room service (two choices only though, an eggs and potato spread or a continental fruit spread, both decent but not delectable) -Surprise discount on parking because we had a hybrid car Cons: -Old hotel that has been decoratively updated, but limited on amenities -Old hotel means weird lack of features you come to expect at hotels like a fan in the bathroom -You can hear buses coming and going at all hours at station across the street -Wouldn't make a effort to return unless needed a familiar convenience

Reviews.Title: “Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: BPadventure
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Very clean, perfect location. Only draw back was there was a lot of noise from the street. I was on the 4th floor overlooking the street. I was offered a quieter room with no view, but I opted for the one with the view. I would not call it a view - it was of the street and buildings. I think at a higher level in the hotel you would have been able to see through the buildings to the sea. I am not a light sleeper so was not bothered by the noise. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will go back to the Bristol - it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “The Bristol Hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Daveron2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great...centrally located, easy access to public transit (trains and busses), close to Gaslight, Harbor, Seaport Village. The price was very reasonable, and the staff was friendly and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel in beautiful downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sunljones
Reviews.Content: The Bristol staff is fantastic. Very helpful and friendly. Super fast and efficent checkin. Fast valet parking. The lobby is clean and pleasant. Rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. Very comfortable bed. The hotel is across the street from the bus station and early morning announcments over the bus station PA system may be bothersome for light sleepers. I sleep with ear plugs and my husband can sleep thru a marching band so it didn't bother us ... but light sleepers it may. Parking is expensive ... as all downtown hotels are. There is a parking garage right down the street that is 10 dollars less a day on week days and 16 dollars less on weekends that will save a few dollars. It may be worth it for longer stays. The public transit has a stop right outside The Bristol door which is super nice. Public transit in San Diego is a must as finding parking anywhere downtown / harbor area is IMPOSSIBLE. Location is perfect. The Bristol is positioned right in the middle of the harbor and the Gaslamp and one block from Horton Plaza. Some have mentioned many homeless/ pan handlers due to hotels proximity to the bus station ... it's no more than any other big city downtown location. Actually, I'd say far less. My guess is that people that have that complaint are not familiar with urban/downtown living. The Bristol is a nice hotel in a great location and while it's not 5 star as others have mentioned it is very clean and has a fantastic staff. I'd gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Clueson
Reviews.Content: Location and access to downtown, gaslamp, trollies, etc. makes this a better than average location. Street noise a little more than expected facing Greyhound. Staff very friendly. Bigger than average room. All in all I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected nice but the Bristol was much better”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: We arrived in early morning and went by hoping to be able to drop off luggage. We were upgraded to a nicer room which was already available. Everything was uphill from there. Staff bent over backwards to be helpful, room was very large for an older hotel and it was so renovated that it was impossible to tell that it was older. Location was perfect as we usually hate to drive on vacation. Location was 1-block from the bus stops, even the bus from the airport which beats renting a car and paying for parking. About a block from the trolley stop and the Transit Store was right on the corner. Buy a 4-day pass for bus & trolley for $15. Service in San Diego is great for a Western City. The Greyhound Station was across the street but almost unnoticeable. There were a few non-aggressive transients around but no more that the rest of downtown. Many fine restaurants within reasonable walking distance-in fact we think this was the best possible downtown location an a great hotel to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Cool vibe...good locale.....great staff”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Was in town for seminar at Westin and it was sold out. Booked this for location and was extremely pleased. It was $90 cheaper than Westin's group rate and it is only about 300 yrds away. I booked the standard king room for 127/night. The room was in good shape and modern. There was a coffee pot with Seattle's best coffee. The soaps and bath products were natural and of good quality and replaced daily. Room was clean with black marble countertops and good water pressure. the minibar was one where you could place your own stuff in it. Bar did happy hour daily with 1/2 off appetizers. The app I had was fantastic and Debbie in the bar was great. (bar closes at ten though)Check in with Derek was easy and they honored my request for quiet room by placing me on backside of hotel. Five pillows on king bed and bed was comfortable. One light had a built in ipod dock and speaker. Elevators were quick and there was a bowl of green apples available at the desk for free. The hotel is across from the bus station but never felt unsafe or saw any issues. There are several nice hotels in this area and seemed policed quite well. High speed internet in room worked well and without issue. Also, there is an in room safe large enough for laptops. The only thing missing was the lack of paper cups to take coffee to go when I was walking to the seminar. The rooms had glass coffee cups. However, when checking out, the clerk asked if there was any one recommendation I could make to improve their service. she actually wrote my suggestion and said it was a good one. She may have been making me feel good but the point was that this hotel seems to care about how to improve its service and actually asked the question. The room could be a five star room but the hotel lacks the amenities of a five star hotel (concierge, spa, full business center) but doesn't have a five star price so all is good. There wasn't a pool and no business center but there are computers with printers in the lobby. I was very happy with my stay and would definately stay here again.......especially at this price point as it is one of the best values around. Other points. Hotel is at the (North?) edge of the gaslamp district and can be a little bit of a hike to petco or some of the places down towards Market. There is a Panera Bread, 7/11, wendys, Pizza Hut, sushi, quiznos within 1 block. Starbucks is about 2 blocks near the mall. There is valet parking and it was in the high 20's per night but was the standard for the area. Also...if going to seminar at Westin....would definately stay here versus Westin considering price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Brynette
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is a small boutique hotel downtown San Diego, very conveniently located. Staff are super-friendly,. Rooms and beds are very comfortable, Hotel is quiet, lovely atmosphere and the welcome at the front desk is warm. Valet parking staff are friendly, courteous and prompt. Restaurant is bright and cheerful, food is good, fresh daisies on each table. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, charming hotel with friendly welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Jason1980_10
Reviews.Content: Chic, charming hotel with friendly welcoming staff. The location is central and safe, close to the Gaslamp and Horton Plaza. The rates are fairly reasonable..less than $120 for a 4 star hotel. For once, I cannot fault this hotel at all. The staff at reception, particularly, a guy called Ahmad, were absolutely great with their friendly service and helpful directions and tips. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for any stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Staff was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: travel4fulfillment
