The location is close to many areas in downtown SD, and very accessible to the freeway. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great break from the chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: cariocaken
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bristol because I have been traveling a lot for work and wanted a break from the anonymity and same-ness of the Westins and Hiltons. Found this hotel on line and was not disappointed. My room with a king bed was enormous, the decor and amenities were top notch, and all the staff was helpful. Very professional hotel, great for business and probably a real treat for a vacation as well. Neighborhood seemed dreary, but I was only there for one night, so can't be sure about that. Try this place, you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “city dwelling for business AND leisure”
Reviews.Author: arkkawmo
Reviews.Content: Very Good service from this hotel. There are employed individuals who will give you the time of day and who are so polite and respectful in their etiquette. Room service was timely and professional and respected your privacy. Food was always at its expected temperature, and the service was polite to stand outside my door to wait for the bill, therefore respecting my privacy. The front desk was very helpful. Since my arrival was at midnight, i took a taxi which cost about $12. But for my return to the airport I took public transportation. It was easy and convenient. From this hotel, ALL public transportation is easy and convenient. And, the office for public transportation is practically next door. You can get any kind of pass and schedule. Bristol was nice to hold my luggage on the last day after I checked out but still had time to explore San D. before having to go to the airport. As for the on site restaurant Dixie's, that is convenient. I had the lavosh pizza. It's served on a cracker, not cracker-like crust. All the ingrediants were prepared well, and they all went well together. This I had in the bar area. Very wonderful bar tender!!! For breakfast, which was what i had for room service, I liked best to just get the basic breakfast with eggs to order, toast, bacon, and fruit instead of potatoes. The San Diego omelet would have been good if they would stick to the ingrediants listed on the menu, but instead they also add green bells and red onion and a lot of both that of course steal the show. They are both raw and strong. "The Currant" is a great place to eat out for breakfast and just across the street. There is a light in the shower! The air system was a bit on the cooler side. The vent was always blowing, so when the unit did not sense to turn on the vents would just blow cool air until the the sensor sensed that it needed to kick on the heat. I got used to it and planned accordingly. There were two little windows that opened to the outdoors. I like being able to open a window. There are few TV channels and nothing ever on. I basically did not use the TV and did not pay for any movies. I used the dry cleaning service which was timely and fine, but my slacks were not as smooth and freshly cleaned as i'm used to...The hotel really has all the great ammenities and charm and style that one would want out of an urban stay, but not quite plush. It's nice and the bed is VERY comfortable. And the robe and towels are nice. But it's not luxurious. I would stay at this hotel again. Mind all though, I only stayed here because I found an $85/night deal online. $150 a night, i don't know about that. But that's MY budget. With the convenience of public transportation, one could save on renting a car, etc. that maybe it all balances out.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL AGAIN IF YOU PAID ME.”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl2009
Reviews.Content: We had a security guard come to our room for a noise complaint. Yes, we played our music loudly but were more than happy to turn the noise down when asked. However, instead of asking nicely the security guard claimed he CALLED THE COPS. It was complete mayhem. I asked the security guard what was going on and he replied with "I can't tell you ma'am." I then asked him for his name and he replied "I can't tell you ma'am." Bizarre right? I asked the front desk staff for the security guard's name and even the staff would not tell me! I left the hotel that night and returned the next morning to speak to the manager hoping to receive some sort of compensation or at the very least an apology. However, surprise surprise, the female manger was a completely incompetent employee of the hotel. She was completely unprofessional and made personal attacks on me instead of apologizing for the way her unprofessional staff handled the situation the night before. I asked her if it was policy to threaten their guests by calling the police. She said this, and I quote, "Yes it is policy to threaten the guests if they deserve it." I literally had to be the bigger person (and keep in mind that I am 23 and the manager is about 45) and walk away from the situation. I have stayed in hotels all over the United States (New York, Miami, Las Vegas, Texas, St. Louis, San Francisco) and she was by far the most immature, unprofessional, incompetent, sorry excuse for a manager I have EVER met. I do not wish this type of service to ANYONE. I'm sure the hotel is fine if there are no issues but as soon as something goes wrong don't expect any help from the management. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: hotboinj
Reviews.Content: It is located in a great location, the staff is top notch, and the place is pristine! We arrived and were met immediately by two friendly staff members. They gave the four of us restaurant recommendations, directions, and what ever else we threw at them. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you Bristol!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Alright Room”
Reviews.Author: ChipperChopper
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to San Diego for the first time in Oct 2008 for our 10 yr anniversary. We chose the hotel because it had some of the best reviews within the Gas Light district, for the price range we were looking for, and for the modern style we wanted. Overall I thought that the experience there was fantastic, and I would recommend it to friends and family. They had attentive and friendly service, clean rooms, and a simple modern feel to the decor. We got a king deluxe room, and the prices then were $229/night. (With the bad economy, they are now $159). It was in a great location. Just around the corner was the mall, where we grabbed a coffee every morning, and only a few blocks up was the main drag, where all the restaurants, and night life was. So, we were relaxed when having an extra drink. Here's some things to think about.. 1) We were on the 7th floor, and although not distracting or overwhelming, we could still hear the traffic below. So, try to get a room as high as you can. 2) There is NO full length mirror in your room/bathroom, and the large 1/2 length mirror does not have a light over/around it. So, when getting ready for a romantic night out, I had to go out to the hallway by the elevators to see what my outfit looked like. And, I had to use the smaller bathroom mirror to put make-up on and fix my hair. This meant that my boyfriend and I had to share the bathroom anytime we were getting ready to go out. 3) Small bathroom. There's a bunch of open space between the bed and the dresser/tv, and the bed and the surrounding walls, but the bathroom was scaled down to accomodate the "open" feel of the main room. 4) Parking isn't free to guests. This is normal for San Diego (and most other cities, these days). We knew ahead of time... which, you may already know, too. But, keep that in mind when choosing a hotel. The Bristol charged $24/night, which is an average price. Some hotels charge more - so be aware of that. I would stay there again, for sure. But, next time we go, we might stay at another hotel, to do some of our own personal comparisons....

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: Zaur
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bristol: Hotel itself is very nice. Nice lobby area, concierge is always on duty even when we were rerturning at 2am or 3am. Very close to the airport. You can take a bus or a cab for $6 one way. The walk is probably 1/2 hour. We booked the cheapest room through Hotels.com. Standard king size room for around $140 a night. Rooms - very nice and modern. Very clean and spacious. Enough space to hang clothes and lots of shelves to store your items. Shower is great. They also provide all the high quality shampoos and soaps as well as robes. Lots of towels. Bathroom is very clean and spacious. Bed is very comfortable and soft. We had a king and it was huge. Nice flat screen TV with lots of channels. They have a clock radio and advertise it to have an MP3 docking station. I didn't find any docking station but the radio does have a CD player. Great quality full size iron and a hair dryer. Air conditioning worked great. It's a little tricky to turn it on. All you have to do is to bring the handle completely down and it will start making noise - letting out air. After 10-15 minutes it cools down really nicely. Other little thing that might be a little tricky is a door handle that opens your room. It opens up instead of usual down. We had 2 key cards and on the third day they stopped working. I brought them down to concierge and they gave us new ones, explaining that if you put those cards with cell phone, credit cards or any metalic material, the key cards get demagnitized. They appologized numerous times for the inconvenience. Hotel located very central on 1st ave. and is short walking distance to 4th, 5th and 6th avenues of the Gaslamp district where all the action is at night. Hotel is located near Greyhound bus terminal that works 24 hrs and you might hear at night some noise due to that. It didn't bother me at all but my wife mentioned that she woke up few times early in the morning because of that. But nothing major. The hotel provides a free internet in the lobby. They have 1 computer that you can use any time of day or night. If you are renting a car, don't expect much help from the help desk. They called around to find us best deal and offered us "the cheapest and most available" rate of $50 before taxes. My wife and I went online and found a great deal with Fox Rental for $22 a day. Elevators at the hotel are actually pretty slow. At one point we waited for 10 minutes for the elevator to come. We ended up taking stairs. But on average it was fine. Many times it was right there with no wait. First day when going down to Lobby level, our elevator dropped to Parking level even though we pressed L. And I mean dropped. The free fall happened from level L to level P. Nothing major, just one floor. We just pressed L and went back up. The doors didn't open automatically, so we pressed Doors Open button and everything was fine. We mentioned it to front desk and they took care of it. We parked our car at the hotel for $22 a night. You have unlimitted access to your car and valet parking parks it for you and brings it back when needed. We tried to park at a nearby parking for $10 a night but you had to be there at 6am or 7am the latest to pick it up. Otherwise, they charge additional $6 an hour after that. I wasn't going to wake up that early on my vacation. Besides, those parkings do not have unlimitted access to your car and will charge every time you leave and then enter back again. Overall, very good hotel. Great value for the price we paid! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for business not pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: milinxs
Reviews.Content: We happened upon this hotel because my company has a relationship with them so we were able to get our corporate rate. We were there just before the holidays and the xmas decorations were very nicely done. Because it was so close to the holidays, the hotel had many holiday parties happening there, which made the hotel very busy and made the elevators always tied up with sometimes a 5 minute wait just to get to our room. We stayed on the 6th floor, and ended up taking the stairs a few times..... the staff informed us that the elevators were having mechanical issues... On the night we arrived, we were exhausted and wanted to order room service and a movie. The sound was awful, no volume, and the quality of the picture was as if the flat screen HD tv had rabbit ears.. we called the front desk and they credited us, but all movies were like that, and there was no one there to repair. The room service was just OK and pretty overpriced for the quality. The location is very convenient, however we felt it was in an unsavory area. We wanted to be in the gaslamp area, which we were, but there were a lot of homeless people, and across the street from the GreyHound bus station (which was our view). For us, the rooms were a little too "modern". All decorations - including carpet and bedding are black and white patterns which we thought was a little much. If you like this decor, you will love this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, but were dealing with problems out of their control. The high speed internet was free and worked very well. This is a good hotel for business travel at a reasonable price, but if you are looking for a romantic relaxing getaway, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol Hotel - Fabulous botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne0424
Reviews.Content: I was attending a seminar at the Bristol hotel and since I am originally from San Diego, I figured I'd better book a stay at the hotel where the conference was being held. Even though the Bristol is downtown and I needed to be wary, the staff was very courteous, helpful and friendly. The hotel looks just like the pictures and I requested a room with a view. I got a room on the 7th floor with a view of the harbor. Jorge the front desk clerk was exceptionally helpful in recommending a little known sushi place just around the corner called Sushi Deli (2). The place was fantastic and the prices were under $10.00 for alot of food. Martin the bartender is very friendly and accommodating at the Bristol and even selected almonds out of the bar snacks for my friend and I. Leslie at the Bristol was equally friendly and followed up quickly when my breakfast was a few minutes late. My room had a couple of problems like the heat not working as much as I would have liked but they brought a heater within 5 minutes of calling the front desk. The next morning I blew a circuit breaker and the maintenance staff arrived within 5 minutes to fix it. Leslie even called back to move me to a different room but I had such a great view that I didn't move. The linens are exeptional and plush, the food at the seminar was great and the location near the Gas Lamp district was very close. They even called a cab for me and extended my late checkout to 2:00pm. Because of their courteous service, I was even able to make the short trip to the airport and catch a earlier flight back to Phoenix. I would definitaly stay at the Bristol again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost the best piece of my my luggage and tells us to sue for it.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoJay
Reviews.Content: The woman who issued me tag for three pieces of luggage, where the most valuable one (including easily pawned items) conveniently disappeared, now she claims that my missing piece is a different color than it was, so her boss says "Sue us". They are fine until a problem emerges. Then if you can't stick around San Diego for weeks to fight them in Small Claims Court, you're out of luck and this untrustworthy staff knows that! Don't have anything of value any where near this den of thieves!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, great location, friendly staff....super hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nancygSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Bristol Hotel and we were thrilled with the accommodations!! We had a spotlessly clean room with a comfortable bed...and even fresh flowers in the room!! I was so impressed with the cleanliness of the halls, lobby, restrooms, elevators, etc. Even more pleasant was the attitude and friendliness of the staff. They always had a smile on their faces and were very efficient at their jobs. We ate in the restaurant and the food and service were excellent. The location is so convenient. We were just blocks from the waterfront and the huge Westfield shopping center was a five minute walk. If we come to San Diego again we will stay at this hotel. We have traveled around the world and only write reviews of places we think have excellent standards at a reasonable price. We highly recommend the Bristol Hotel to San Diego visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMartinOriginals
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the downtown San Diego Bristol during the last week of October 2008. Some bad points about the hotel are its location, which can be a little sketchy after dark. There are many homeless bums on the surrounding streets (even the daytime). Although most of them are harmless, you still need to be alert. Another bad point is that the rooms are slightly older, as is the entire hotel. One other bad point is that I could hear the traffic (train and airplane) noise constantly, but that's probably true for all downtown hotels in San Diego, since the airport is so close by. I did use earplugs to sleep every night, as my neighbors were sometimes noisy. The TV was ok, but there were no movie channels (HBO, etc.). Good points are that the hotel staff are great. The front desk staff are very helpful and nice. The cleaning staff are also very polite. They never came before 10AM to start cleaning my room, so the mornings were quiet. There were free apples at the front desk, which were nice. The rooms were very clean and I was satisfied with that aspect of it. The lobby of the hotel is also very cute and comfortable. So, there were good and bad aspects of this hotel, but I think that there is more good than bad.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bluecornIreland
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the bristol for 6 nights in september.initial impression was very good and the check in receptionist charming.got upgraded to a luxury suite that was amazing.originally planned to stay one night but extended it because of the location downtown. if i had one criticism it would be regarding the food. although the quality was good the staff seemed very inexperienced and absent when you really needed something.front desk superb especially the girl from rhode island. we would stay there again in the future and we felt it was a good price for downtown san diego.

Reviews.Title: “great 'boutique' hotel in downtown - charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: irishmm
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Bristol for 4 days, while attending a conference at the Westin (Gaslamp). The Brisol was $100.00 less per night than a room at the Westin would have been, and was less than 2 blocks from the Westin. My room was spotless, and well-maintained by the hotel staff. Desk staff were friendly and helpful overall. I was able to use a computer in the lobby (free of charge) to print up my airline ticket, and to check e-mail. There was an inroom safe, free of charge. The hotel is well-located (downtown); I did a lot of walking by myself in the area, including in the evening, and had no problems. San Diego's a big city, with its share of street people and other assorted characters, but I never felt unsafe walking from the hotel to the old train station (check it out; it's gorgeous), to Horton Plaza (2 blocks away), or to the Pier shopping area. Gaslamp District is very close also. An Airport Flyer bus stops less than a block from the hotel, at a cost of $2.25 (versus about $15.00 and a wild trip from the airport with an angry cab driver); I recommend taking the bus to/from the airport, if you can. I also recommend asking for a room below the 8th floor. The 9th floor is an uncarpeted ballroom. On two weekend nights when I was there (in my 8th floor room), there were events which could be heard through the ceiling (music, furniture being dragged across the floor), up to and after midnight. Quieted down about 1:00 a.m. Other than that, no problems with noise. Guest rooms are carpeted, so you should be okay on a lower floor. On the whole, I would definitely return to the Bristol. I like the hotel - it's a well-kept/updated older building, well-appointed and with interesting architecture. My room was very comfortable and oh-so-clean. At $139.00 a night, it was a great deal for the area. If time allows, have a Mai Tai at the Bali Hai restaurant on Shelter Island! Best I've found, anywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Bristol!!”
Reviews.Author: Meg4273
Reviews.Content: Upon first checking into the Bristol, the hotel seemed decent. The price was competitive for downtown San Diego, and the rooms were clean, well decorated, and fairly quiet (as quiet as downtown can be). However, little did we know, the Bristol would be checking people into our room while we were sleeping throughout the night! When we first checked in we informed the staff at the front desk that we were from San Diego, used to live in downtown, and that we were staying at the Bristol so we could be within walking distance to the Convention Center (where we would taking the CA Bar Exam for the following three days). The first night the hotel checked a party into our room at approxiamtely 10:30 p.m. We had gone to sleep at 9:00 p.m. seeing as though the Bar Exam was the most important test of our lives only to be woken up an hour and half later by people trying to enter the room. When we yelled to the people on the other side of the door that we were already checked into the room, the people decided to go get security to help them get into the room... and security attempted to help them! We told the security we were validly checked into the room and that we were trying to sleep, thinking that would solve the problem. However, again at midnight - people trying to get in. AGAIN at 1:30 in the morning - a whole family trying to get it! Finally we had it! I called down to the front desk demanding they stop checking different people into our room, explained my frustration that I needed sleep before the first day of the Bar Exam and could not get it because the hotel kept checking people into our room, and I was informed that I WAS NOT CHECKED IN AND NOT IN THE SYSTEM!! The guy at the desk said that he would make a note not to check anyone else in and that I would need to check in again in the morning or bring proof that I was checked in... AND I DID! In the morning, on the way to the first day of testing, I stopped by and showed proof that I had paid for the room for 3 nights at $149 a night, and they still had no record of us checking in! In the back of our minds throughout the day of testing we were wondering if people we checked into our room while we were gone and if our belongings were safe... During the remainder of our stay I stopped by the front desk asking for a manager to speak to about the situation and NO MANAGER SEEMED TO EVER BE AVAILABLE. Finally, when we were checking out a manager magically appeared. When I explained that I felt we should be discounted for the night that we lost sleep due to the hotel's oversight, the manager was rude, short, and dismissive. She even rolled her eyes when she thought I wasn't looking. We will never stay at the Bristol again and highly encourage all others to think twice before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: Naveron
Reviews.Content: There are some great features about the Bristol: The location is very convenient for exploring the Gaslamp and Downtown districts. It is close to the airport and transit system and shopping so that is a plus. The room was spacious and clean. There were a couple of things that were a bit of a problem: Daisy's the onsite restaurant was very gloomy and even though we had breakfast vouchers, the experience could have been better. The rooms do tend to pick up noise from both outside and inside (other guests). it was a good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: millercgr
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. When I checked in, I was told there was no longer a regular room with one king size bed, I was then upgraded to a deluxe! The room was superb, it was huge, clean, comfortable. Location is perfect it's near everything. The trolley is one block away, Gaslamp District, and the Harbor are close by, Balboa Park isn't far. Staff extremely friendly. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MadridWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location (two blocks from Gaslamp Quarter). The room was big and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was full of nice toiletries, that were duly replenished. Lots of fresh towels and even bathrobes. Free security box within the room and free Internet (with printer) in the lobby. Very helpful employees. The only negative things were the high price of the parking and the constant noise from the exterior. It was a sort of constant loud hum (probably coming from the parking vents) but as it was steady you could sleep, once you got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S OK”
Reviews.Author: DANTRIPFREE
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price, close to downtown, that's hall!! If you visit San Diego on vacation, I suggest to stay in Coronado or la Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but shows its roots.”
Reviews.Author: RobertSmithies
Reviews.Content: Not the best place, but OK. The room was huge, and a lot of things were fine. But some of the details, like a funky and clearly worn-down bathtub, the bizarre hall carpeting, and the early morning work in the wall next to the room (not to mention the worker making out with his girlfriend in the elevator), gave this place a 'trying to make it' vibe rather than 'got it together'.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in ok location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-Steve
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Bristol while attending a conference in San Diego. I attend this conference every year and have stayed at many downtown hotels. The Bristol is a great little boutique hotel - the staff were very accommodating - and the rooms were clean with free internet etc. On the negative side, it is quite a hike from the convention center although close to Horton Plaza and Gaslamp. The biggest problem is the location across from the main bus/transit station which made me uncomfortable (as a woman) walking back alone in the evenings. If I had been with a larger group or with my spouse, this wouldn't be such an issue. I would definitely stay there again, but would choose other hotels over this if their location was a bit closer to the convention center and in a safer area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and stylish”
Reviews.Author: MoNo79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleseant surprise. Rooms were stylish and spacious and the staff was nice and helpful. Close to shopping and dining facilities downtown. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What a great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jumpin_rice
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels before and there are 2 things that are really important to me: cleanliness and service. Hotel Bristol was really great in both! Let me start off saying that I really appreciated how they catered to my note attached to the reservation. They upgraded my room to accommodate for free! Considering that there are a lot of hotels in downtown, the price was great - especially for a weekend. (orbitz) Their bathroom products were actually really nice, plenty of towels, the bed was super white and clean as well. The pillows were heavenly, and I loved the fact that they had an IPOD dock that you can use with your IPOD to listen to music in the room. The only thing that threw me off a little was the bathroom door. Instead of an actual door that closes, it slides like a closet. If you're a couple or sharing this room with someone, it might be a little awkward when trying to get some privacy. =) Overall, I had no complaints about this place at all. I'll most definitely be going back to this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: schulace
Reviews.Content: Spent a recent on night stay on a business related trip; my high end chain was oversold and couldn't accommodate an extension to my stay. I contacted the front desk at The Bristol directly, and booked for that night. The brief encounters with the staff (check-in and out) were pleasant enough and staff seemed eager to be helpful. Room was reasonably sized with a nod toward trendy decor, no problems with the wireless internet, and comfortable bed/linens. Not much of a view, but my stay was brief. All things considered, it exceeded my expectations considering the other more expensive options that were available at that time. Would recommend, and re-book again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Thrilled-With Carrying My Own Luggage in From Street”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: I was in town for BIO 2008 and booked the Bristol When I got in at app. 8PM the cab left me at the curb and the employes in the lobby stared at me. I walked up to the door and stuck my head in and the girl at counter said hi- but the two guys just stared. I could not believe it. Then I fumbled in with my luggage (no small feat) and went to check in. I clarified that I needed a room with a desk and was told all have rooms have them. Then I asked if it was safe to walk around and where could I find a convenience store. I was told how to go to Ralph's and then told it was safe as long as I didn't go right when I left the lobby. Hmmmm. I got to room and there was a small round top table with no chair by window and two beds. Called down and they said ok we will move you to the king you requested. Went to that room and it was again a table with no chair. I was exhausted-went to Ralph's and fell asleep. When I woke up I saw I was across the street from GREYHOUND bus station. Aha- perhaps that is why I was told not to go right when exiting. The room was almost cool to look at it until you looked close and noticed where things were not painted or finished. I was not happy overall and did not want a hassle. I had already moved a heavy arm chair and floor lamp (both were in an odd little alcove by themselves) to table to make it almost a workspace -not to mention 50+ lbs of luggage (still cannot figure out why those two young men were sitting around looking so bored and not helping anyone) and decided it was just time to leave. I made some quick calls and found a room at Hampton Inn by the harbor. Checked out and zipped over there. Glad I did. I love botique hotels but they have to be well run and service has to be great to make it work-the Bristol is neither of those things (I will say the young man who checked me out was pleasant)Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol - affordable luxury!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalYayaMama
Reviews.Content: We went to the Bristol for a ladies' weekend in San Diego. The Bristol is centrally located in dowtown. We walked or took the Trolley everywhere. The rooms were nicely appointed. Our shower was not working well, and was repaired immediately. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Free internet access in the lobby was a plus. Main drawbacks were the steep on-site parking fee ($22/night) and limited on-site amenities (pool, hosted lounge, small gym). We stayed on the back side of the hotel, so there wasn't any view but noise was kept to a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “did not honor our prepaid reservations and did nothing to reserach the problem”
Reviews.Author: ana77
Reviews.Content: I booked Bristol through hotels.com, prepaid and received booking confirmation. On the day of arrival I called to tell that i would be arriving late and was told that they donâ€™t see my reservation. I asked whether any rooms at all were available but front desk Amanda did not want to check before we arrive there - ignoring the fact that we need to drive 2 hours to get there. Three calls and 10 minutes of holding later, she agreed to check availability and informed me that after all guests check in (it was around 12 am by then) there would be no rooms available. After a lot of effort, we were able to get in touch with hotels.com support (in India) and after a hard copy reservation was faxed over to Bristol hotel, they agreed to accommodate us. After all, the rooms were in fact available. I left a message for the manager but he/she never got back to me. Hotel not honoring your prepaid reservation and making no effort to research it I consider to be a a major flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol is a boutique gem”
Reviews.Author: bos2nians
Reviews.Content: The Bristol is a boutique gem! The hotel exceeded our expectations. We stayed there the first week in April. The room was spacious and the bathroom well supplied. Even though there was a Greyhound Bus terminal across the street we were not bothered by noise. From our room on the 8th floor we caught a glimpse of the ocean and a lot of the skyline. The staff was both gracious and efficient, responding promptly to our request for help with the air conditioner. Daisies was a bit pricey for breakfast but the location lends itself to lots of options for restaurants within walking distance. We walked to Horton Plaza, Seaport Village and the ferry to Coronado. The bus to Balboa park was just one street over. Hope to return. 2 travelers from near Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: rxsooner
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Diego where we attended a national conference, and for our needs The Bristol Hotel was a great place to stay. It was just a short trolley ride to the convention center and just a few blocks of walking to get most anywhere in the Gaslamp District. In comparison to many of the other lodging options in the immediate area, it was by far the best deal for the price. Overall, the rooms were nice and clean. The beds were comfortable, the spacious room was decorated with a modern flair, and the in room wireless was a nice amenity. The only complaint that I had was the bottom of the tub was peeling and the closet door and bathroom ceiling were unpainted. I won't lie, the noise level is rather high, especially when you're trying to sleep in. However, it is in the heart of the business district and next door to a trolley stop and bus terminal. I guess the real question is - would I stay there again? And the answer is for the price, the location, the amenities, and the overalll presentation of the hotel - definitely yes. I would also recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Awful Beds”
Reviews.Author: vacationvan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay as close to the Gaslamp Quarter as possible in downtown San Diego without spending too much. We booked a hotel through Expedia.com and got 3 nights at the Bristol Hotel for under $180 a night. The hotel was situated in a pretty good location. It was just a few blocks from the Gaslamp Quarter, a huge Ralphs market, and the Horton Plaza. Our room was pretty tiny but it was furnished in a fun contemporary style and had a flat screen TV. The view was also great. We were facing out toward 1st street and could see the Bay in the distance. My only issue with this hotel was the beds. The mattresses were awful! I mean, really really bad. Not only were they cheap mattresses with no padding, but the ones in our room were clearly damaged. The moment we sat on them they sagged down to the floor. We asked for a new room the next day and were moved to the opposite side of the hotel. We lost our great view, but at least the mattresses weren't sagging to the floor. If this hotel refurnished their beds with new mattresses so their guests could get a good night sleep, I would love to stay there again. But until then, I'll stay somewhere else the next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice boutique hotel in the heart of downtown. I was in San Diego for a convention, and loved the proximity to the convention center and the Gaslamp District. The room was beautifully furnished, the beds were comfy, and the amenities such as the robes and towels were very nice. The staff was friendly and they let us check in very early which was great because we needed to setup for the tradeshow. I can only say two bad things about the hotel and they are so minor that its barely worth mentioning. The bathroom didn't have a trash can, and one day they forgot to supply washcloths.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MathiasStockholm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife really enjoyed this small cozy hotel in downtown San diego. A nice lobby with free internet. Our room was pretty with a free candy jar. Really nice touch! We also had a nice view of the bay. Hotel has a good location in San Diego. You can explore all of downtown attractions by foot. We even took a lovely walk to Balboa Park. We really recommend that you spend a day in Balboa Park. Architecture in the park is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller014
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for a city break-getaway. Bristol is a cute boutique hotel, newly decorated, clean rooms, surprised to find upscale amenities and even robes, free wifi. Service was very good. Valet for our car was efficient. We loved the location as it was within walking distance to Horton Plaza, Gaslamp and the Harbor. Try their breakfast room service which had a great selection. Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineEshelman
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and was looking for a cheap hotel downtown to make a night out of my company Christmas party at a nearby club. After reading reviews online I figured this was going to be a hit or miss. As soon as we pulled up we hit a home run. Metered parking was available right out front so we instantly saved $22. Inside was bright and beautifully decorated. The check-in process was a tad slow with only 1 employee and a line of 3 guests but service was friendly and warm. Upon check -in we were informed that the heater was broken until further notice but $30 was taken off the price of the room which was more than fine for us, considering we didn't plan on being in the room for extended periods of time except to sleep when cold temps are preferred. The room was BEAUTIFUL! And spacious to boot. We were very impressed from the get go. Before heading out we stopped by the bar and had the signature Crazy Daisy martini made by the bartender Kevin. Have to say I was definitely impressed by this drink and his friendliness. We spent about an hour with Kevin and a server from the adjacent restaurant named Mark and had a great time. The next morning while walking around downtown looking for a good breakfast my boyfriend commented that he felt like we just had a mini vacation even though we were so close to home. 2 thumbs way up for the Bristol!

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: This hotel was slightly less than I was expecting. It was in a good location near the gaslamp quarter. Service was okay and the property was a bit used (more so in the rooms). No major pros or cons but I would wait for a refreshment of the rooms before I stay again as there is a lot of choice in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Trying Hard, but Still Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: thejuj
Reviews.Content: It's a sad fact that even a really, really great downtown location, updated room decor, and a great staff just can't overcome certain fundamental deficiencies in a hotel - like the view of and noise from a Greyhound bus barn at 5:45 AM, extremely thin walls, and bathrooms modeled on mid-1980s youth hostels in Europe. The Bristol is central to everything and the staff were delightful. It is difficult for a traveler to be delightful, however, when he or she hasn't slept in 3 nights and hasn't taken a functional shower because (a) the shower floor has no lip, so the water gets everywhere and (b) the shower itself has no soap dish (hello - come on, guys - put a soap dish IN the shower - work with me here!) so you're tired, your socks are wet AND you're surly. They try hard, they mean well. If you're young, budget-conscious and truly oblivious to noise, the Bristol will be fine. If you have to work in the morning, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Smessen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night but wish it could have been more! Hotel was unique and affordable! Great location and very friendly staff. Parking was a bit of an issue. My friend had a box on top of her car which would not fit into any parking deck. Spent 45 minutes driving around looking for a spot .... the valet attendents were not helpful. Bathroom is a little odd but do-able! Would definitely recommend the Bristol to any visitors to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rme520
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol during Comic Con weekend. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the Convention Center, Gaslamp District and Little Italy. We were able to check in early. Four of us stayed in room 316, which has a view of First Ave. Street noise was pretty minimal. The bathroom was big. Two odd things though, there was no bathtub. Just a couple of towels on the floor kept water from running from the shower area to the rest of the bathroom. I'm guessing this was a handicap accessible room. Also, the door to the bathroom was just a folding closet type door and you could hear everything. There is a computer with internet access in the lobby, which was handy. Staff seemed friendly and they held our luggage after we checked out. Parking was $22 a day. Only watch out, since Comic Con was going on we couldn't park until after 5pm the day we checked in. The hotel parking was full. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Powerofone
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect after reading other reviews. I was also concerned because it was one of the last hotels to still have rooms available on a Saturday night while the ComicCon convention was going on. Since there wasn't much else available so close to the Convention Center, I decided to go ahead and booked two rooms. We were not disappointed. In fact, we were quite impressed. It is an older hotel but you couldn't tell it by the updating they have put into. The lobby is small, but was still inviting and had a touch of elegance to it. The rooms were the typical size of a hotel room with the usual amenities. But you could tell they had recently remodeled them since the paint, rug, and decor was quite modern. The beds and bedding, while not quite up to the Westin's Heavenly Beds standards, came pretty close. They were very comfortable and we slept very well. Our room had no view as it faced the wall of the building across the street. That wasn't a big deal because we were only there the one night. It did become a problem was we forgot to pull the darkening shades across and the reflection from the building caused the room to be excessively bright. Once we pulled them, it was okay. Also our bathroom had his funky folding door that didn't really close all of the way. However, our children's room had a sliding door that worked fine. Overall, these were are only complaints. We found the Bristol to be very quiet, very clean, and very comfortable. We ate at their restaurant for breakfast and the food was good. We only had limited contact with the staff, but we found them friendly and helpful. We also liked how the valet service isn't on the street, but you make a right turn into a driveway. With it's close proxity to the Convention Center and the reasonable price, we would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Theft at the Bristol”
Reviews.Author: rigotucson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bristol since my brother was having his wedding reception there, so did a lot of my family and family of the bride. The next day my wife and I went and spent the day at the beach and sight seeing in downtown. We got back to the hotel went to bed, the next day we got up and started packing and realized my cufflinks that were a gift from my brother for being his best man were not in the box i had put them in. I specifically remember putting them away the night of the wedding. After tearing the room apart looking for them a family member came to the room to tell me he was also missing something. He then began to tell me an uncle had his Ipod taken from his breifcase. We contacted the guest manager and told her what had happened. She had us fill out a form. And said she would conact us in a couple of days, which she didn't, I contacted her only to be treated like it was my fault that i left it in the room. She also said they had checked the computer to see who had used their keys to enter the room. Supposedly we never left the room, which is a lie. Everybody else has recieved the wonderful Bristol treatment that i know of. To much to write! Stay there if you want, just dont take any of your belongings with you on your stay if you want them when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: NASAretired
Reviews.Content: This property is located in the central business/federal district and close to the waterfront and Gas Lamp district also. It is done in a very tasteful modern decor. Valet parking in the circular drive which avoids parking at the curb of the always busy street as at some other hotels in this area. Quality trained staff. Excellent restaurant. One and a half blocks to the large Horton Plaza Shopping/Entertainment Center. Excellent value for location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: girella
Reviews.Content: Probably it's what you call a business man hotel and we were tourists but it was very pleasant for us too!! The rooms are nice, spacious and clean. Our friends were given a room at the top and it had evidently been refurbished recently so it was really smart! The service was efficient and the location very good because it's near the town center/restaurants and a short walk to the sea front. No parking problems because there's a valet parking service. No complementary breakfast but there's a cafÃ¨ just in front of the hotel. Would certainly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: dvsdeedee
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on June 21, 2007 and were very pleased with our experience. Hotel staff was friendly and knowledgable about local attractions. The room was spotless and nicely appointed. Free internet, available room service and a nice little restaurant and bar on the property. Hotel is located a block away from the Civic Center trolley station. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large peaceful room at reasonable price for central location”
Reviews.Author: Rooftop_living
Reviews.Content: More than happy with our accommodation during our 2-night stay at the Bristol, especially as we were given a room upgrade. The room was huge, stylishly decorated and new looking and the bathroom was lovely with a big bath. There were bathrobes and a mini-bar. We checked in really late and had stumbled upon the hotel driving past. I requested a quiet room and it was lovely and peaceful. The room cost us $149 per night & $16 tax. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, as were the car-parking staff. There is access to the internet at reception (at no charge). There were 2 slight disappointments. Firstly, the breakfast (not included in room price, $26 for 2 of us) - the portions were meagre for the price in comparison to some of the more substantial breakfasts weâ€™d had elsewhere â€“ however, it was tasty. Secondly, (and I was more annoyed by this) we started using the car-park at about 01:00 and left the car for a total of approx 40 hours and were charged 2.5 days rather than the 2 days that we were expecting (at $22 per day). The justification was charges donâ€™t begin from the time the car is left (?!), but their charges run from something like noon to noon, so essentially we had to pay for 13 hours of parking that started prior to our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol took me by surprise”
Reviews.Author: boosparkles
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much when I booked the hotel initially, but when we got the hotel I was impressed. Having just gone through a remodel, walking down the hallways you can see the under paint in some areas, but overall the hotel was semi-polished, trendy, but small. Our rooms were decent. Our heater worked on-off. It's not a very large hotel and I would say I wasn't a fan of the surrounding areas. The valet was extremely friendly and ended up knowing our names by the end of our stay. The front desk was extremely helpful in assisting us with maps, directions and eateries. Overall, I was satisfied with this three-star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobywaldo
Reviews.Content: I was recently a guest at the Bristol San Diego, along with three of my girlfirends. We were on the 8th floor, and could'nt hear any street noise. The hotel staff was wonderful and accomodating, and made us feel very welcome! My recommendation for breakfast isCafe 222, and just for future reference for out-of-towners, the Bristol is a 4 minute walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous decor in this great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsbfjW
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its great location and the rate compared to many other hotels in or near the Gaslamp District and the fact that it has parking, we were not disappointed. The decor is bright, clean and new and the rooms feel more like bedrooms that hotel rooms, which is lovely. I had requested a room at the back of the hotel on the 7th floor, on the advice from other reviews on Tripadvisor and would recommend this as it was very quiet. The room was big and there were nice touches such as mugs rather than plastic cups for coffee and a duvet rather than blankets. I would highly recommend this hotel and can not believe what great value it was.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: ABSChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs lots of work and the location across from the bus station is horrible. If you open your windows you get the hurrendous smell of diesel fuel. The TV / remote in the room did not work even after they supposedly fixed it by giving me a second remote for turning it on/ off and for volume. The room remodel cannot start soon enough. I'm not sure what they can do about the bus fumes.........

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly better than I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: SDParadiseJewelry
Reviews.Content: This is an above average 3 star hotel. It is beautifully decorated. And they are also working on re-doing the hotel rooms , and adding plasma screen TV's to each room. My husband and I live in San Diego, and we stayed at this hotel for his 30th High School reunion to spend more time with his classmates. It had a great banquent room on the 9th floor, in which the roof opened up above the dance floor which was really nice. Great seeing the stars while dancing. The positives. 1) Clever decorations, kinda of Art Deco. Flowers in vases at every corner. 2) Very comfortable bed. 3) Nice mini bar. 4) Close to the happening spots in Downtown. Great price for the location. 5) Great breakfast food in their restaurant. We ate with 6 people and everyone enjoyed their breakfast. 6) Front desk gave us a room away from the bus station so we had a good nights sleep. 7) Nice banquet room. 8) Nice bar to meet up with friends. 9) Very nice lobby with lots of very comfortable attractive furniture. The negatives. 1) Dark lighting in the room 2) Therefore bathroom needs a make-up mirror. 3) Not much storage space for clothing for 2 people if you are going to stay awhile. Our room had 3 little drawers. 4) No drawers in the bathroom to store toiletries. 5) Not a safe location to walk around in at late at night, take a taxi if you want to go somewhere. If you are walking in a large group you will be okay. Just don't go out alone at night. 6) The banquet room could use some noise absorbing carpet or something, as it got very loud in the room with the sound ricocheting off the tile floors, the walls and windows. All and all it was a very nice experience, and quite surprising. I think if the hotel did a couple of extra things, it can easily increase it's rating to a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except....”
Reviews.Author: sgtraveller79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bristol hotel for about 6 nights in June. It was a nice hotel with nice rooms. Everything was fine except that the security of the hotel can be improved. This man entered the lift with us and followed us to our room. He pretended to be opening the door of the room next to us but obviously was pretending. After we entered our room, we saw through the peephole and he was loitering outside our room. Called the security but the security did not do much. Quite frightening. Other than this, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Bristol”
Reviews.Author: Postscript
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a fantastic stay at the Bristol in San Diego for one week. I was in town for a convention and wanted a reasonably priced hotel. This hotel was very well located and much better priced than the major convention hotels. I got a room for 149.00 a night. I took the advice given on this site and asked for a room far away from the bus station. The staff was very helpful and gave me a great room in the back. No view but I could open the windows and get a breeze with privacy and no problems with noise. The room was very clean and comfortable. It had a small area with two chairs and a small table. There was a nice desk and chair. The king sized bed had a pillow top mattress and I slept like a baby. The only problem I had was the very large over stuffed pillows were too big for me to sleep on so I used the soft terry cloth robe provided as my pillow. I ate a few nights at the in hotel restaurant and the food was very good. Horton Plaza shopping center with everything you could want was only a short walk away. I had no problem walking to the convention center or the waterfront and I am not the most in shape person. I did not feel safe to walk around the neighborhood at night by myself. I was able to check my email a few times a day on the computer for guest use at the front desk. The staff answered every request I made. My only problem was finding the week over and having to come home!

Reviews.Title: “all well but never quiet”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: For the price, Bristol hotel offers much above average. We checked in the group of 12 and though rather slow check-in system, staff was very friendly and efficient. The refurbished room is pretty generous, with ample space (close to junior suite) and nice selection of toileteries. Working section is terrific. Having said all, it is close to impossible to get a decent sleep with windows ajar. Traffic noise, buses, horns, everything coming into life 24 hours. I stayed on the 4th floor and noises are amplified. They have fitness but would be easily dismissed due very limited selection of equipments. Location is far from the hot spot. All in all, this is a good place for it's price. We have no problem to stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff/Service”
Reviews.Author: psatty
Reviews.Content: First, the staff at this hotel seemed to hate their guests. We are an inconvenience. They were rude and flat out refused to provide service. For example, my boyfriend ordered coffee and milk from room service. The coffee came but without milk - so he just used the cream. Turns out the cream was rancid. When we called to get a replacement they refused, and argued with us on the phone saying there was nothing wrong with the cream or the coffee and they weren't going to give us a "freebee." We hadn't even drank any of the rancid coffee!! And it only got worse from there. The second problem is this hotel claims to be a contemporary boutique, but doesn't have wireless internet. Third, you can't get a good night's sleep because the bus station right across the street is going 24-7. Fourth, it is walking distance from the Gaslamp -- but only if you don't mind a hike through some sketchy areas at night (see #3 above re: the Greyhound bus station).

Reviews.Title: “clean, hip hotel that could use better staff”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol March 15 - 17. The whole town was packed due to the convergence of NCAA, the Baseball Classic and two large conventions, not to mention the St. Patrick's Day festivities. We've stayed at this hotel before and were pleased to get a $149 rate since the town was almost booked up. This is a small boutique hotel not far from Horton Plaza Mall (four blocks) and the Gaslamp quarter (six blocks). It isn't in a scenic area but it is clean and safe. Yes, there is a Greyhound station next door and downtown tends to be noisy. This is a somewhat artsy hotel, with bright yellow paint in the halls that fades upwards to an orange. Paired with the blue carpet, is has a Warhol/Lichtenstein effect. Lots of pop art is the hallways completes the decor. It has a small bright lobby with overstuffed red and blue chairs. The rooms are large and have minimal art deco furniture with very comfortable beds. The windows open, which is rare in a hotel, but the city noise makes it an almost moot choice. The linens are bright red and orange. There are two robes in the closet and the bathroom is larger than average, with great water pressure and temperature. The toilets look brand new and somewhat "gadgety". I loved the soap and shampoo -a vanilla/almond scent. The bath has a pocket door with a small pull to use (just run your finger over it and it pops out), the door may be heavy but it easy to use once you get the hang of it - it saves lots of room in the bath. I thought it was weird that there was no safety latch on the door to the hallway, just a regular lock. Free Internet access was available in all rooms, and there is also a free computer in the lobby to use. The Daisy Cafe is small and the food just OK, nothing special, but good for a quick breakfast or lunch. The front desk staff could definitly use some customer service training - not very friendly or helpful, or even apologetic when they didn't have an answer. The phones seemed busy, so they may have been understaffed. All in all, it was a great deal since the Omni and Marriott were over $300 per night. The trolley stops at the corner and taxis to the airport are less than $10. It is a good fifteen minute walk to the convention center or Petco Park, but through a safe part of town. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Multiple problems with my stay. The hotel had overbooked, so on my arrival told me they were sending me for 1 night to the Holiday Inn and that they were taking care of it. They paid for neither the taxi to the other hotel or the other hotel room, as is the customary practice in such cases. When I finally got to check in to my room the next day, the bathroom still had dirty towels in the tub and there were empty shopping bags in the room. I signed up to have breakfast delivered within a 15 minute window the next morning and it was 10 minutes later than that window and no one would answered the phone when I tried to call room service about it. When I complained at the front desk, I got no resolution to the problems. Overall, a very pretty hotel with terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They don't tell you that they are located directly across from the busy, dirty and loud Greyhound Bus Terminal. The dated decor is old. The staff kept telling us that they will be re-painting soon, but meanwhile the hotel room and hallways felt old and it was clearly in need of an update. Room service was prompt, but they had no carts to bring the food up on. Two of our fellow business travelers had no heat in their room and were not moved to other rooms. While San Diego is a great place to visit, I would recommend the hotels on the waterfront near Seaport village or other hotels on Coronado Island. I felt like I was staying in a Motel rather than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over 4th of July and was pleasantly surprised with the size of the rooms. My friend was staying at the W and our standard room here was at least 3 times as large. The whole hotel had a very hip design, like the W, but the price here was much better. We ate at the cafe for breakfast which was pretty good as well. The front desk was very helpful and even printed out our boarding passes so we wouldn't have to wait at the airport. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Toilet paper sail boats!”
Reviews.Author: Bonpierce
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Easy to walk to Gaslamp quater and Horvath Mall. Lots of restaurants to choose from. We were also given a choice of "view" with some noise or quiet and no view. We chose the view side. You do get a glimpse of the oceanliner dock and can see plenty of ships floatingby, however the bus depot loading area is right across the street. I don't think it matters how high up you are. They had buses idleing in the lot all night long. And then the announcements start about 5 am. Our bathroom had a solid pocket door but it was so heavy and no handle to use, it was easier to just leave it open. I thought the water temp was just fine. The hair dryer worked. The one thing I didn't like was the lock on the refrigerator. There is a mini bar in it and you have to decide at check in if you want the key. I just wanted to keep some beers cold, luckily I don't mind a warm ale. Staff was friendly. The hotel is cool with modern designs and artwork. $18 to valet park, or you can risk parking on the street if you can find a place. Breakfast was good but overpriced, I would go elsewhere for that next time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol Hotel, San Diego - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. Everywhere is bright and clean and our room was gorgeous, 'fresh', and spotless. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was devine at a fair price. We didn't have any noise disturbance from the Greyhound station opposite at all. We would highly recommend this hotel. The only thing we didn't like was the unlockable sliding door to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: CONS: Hotel clerk started by offering us an "upgrade" so we could have a view (Greyhound bus station). -Room had a bathroom sliding louvered door with no privacy, handle or lock. -We stayed on the "quiet" side. So many people running up and down the halls, slamming doors, yelling like they were at a ball game at 2 AM. -Staff unfriendly, rude, unknowledgeable (except the maids were nice and polite). -Restaurant very expensive menu and we went in there but no one was there so we left and got a sandwich down the street. -We felt very unwelcome at this hotel. Everyone else in San Diego were so nice to us we couldn't figure out why our hotel staff was so bad. -TV had no stations of interest unless you paid higher prices for what you watched. Awful. PROS: -Maids kept our room spotless and were very nice to us saying "good morning" etc. -Close to a lot of downtown activities, dining, and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Care to Sleep, Stay at the Bristol Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bristol Hotel Sept. 22-25, 2005. The hotel itself was nice, staff nice and helpful, conveniently located by the gaslamp, and it was easy to get a taxi Upon check in we were given the option of a room with or without a view, the room with a view would have a little noise. Since we were told it would be on the seventh floor, we took the room with the view thinking that the noise probably wouldn't be that bad that high up. Little did we know the view consisted of the Greyhound station (located across the street) with a very early morning wake up call (5:00am) of loud announcements and bus noise. Not to mention their light rail train system was also right next to the hotel so we could hear that every time it went by. We thought about changing rooms, but the other side was literally a white brick wall which we thought would be worse with the light rail train system. So if sleep isn't that important, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Traveler142.5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bristol for 1 week and will not be returning. We were placed in a room with two double beds although we had requested a king size bed. I only note this because once we were moved to a room with a king size bed, it was even worse than the original room. The batteries in the tv's remote control were dead. There was zero privacy since the door to the bathroom was a flimsy sliding door on squeaky hinges with no lock. The water temp in the shower was nearly impossible to adjust. The bathtub was chipped and peeling. In the living area the decor was too bright and ugly (red and orange stripes, brown stripe curtains, etc.). The air conditioning control box must have been from about 1970 and was hard to regulate. The comforter had a crusty stain in the middle of it. As far as the noise level, it was really difficult to sleep due to the Greyhound Bus station across the street. The joke with fellow customers of this hotel was trying to figure out which floor the elevator would "land" on. I never knew which floor the elevators would take me to, if you pressed 5 you might end up in the parking garage, it was very unreliable. The main "pro" of this hotel is its location. The Bristol is within walking distance to many downtown activities.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Cute, and Easy”
Reviews.Author: dogboy87
Reviews.Content: This is a great bargain hotel -- small boutique hotel with a distinct look and feel. I stayed here for four days (brief vacation combined with a wedding) There are some faults with the service but, overall, it's hard to beat the "value." It's a small, intimate hotel and while the downtown location made it ideal for getting around on foot, there was some issue with noise -- not from traffic or people but from the whirling exhaust fans of neighboring buildings. It's not terrible by any means but if you're a particularly light sleeper this might bother you. There's a train stop (light rail) right outside the door, a couple of convenience stores around the corner, and you're only about two or three blocks from the main streets where all the restaurants and shops are. San Diego is not really my sort of city but if I had to go back there I would definitely stay at the Bristol again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: elle55407
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES>>>Got a great deal on this hotel...and compared to others in the area, it was a steal. EXCELLENT location. Very convenient to shopping and restaurants. Room was bigger than I expected and very clean. Staff was accomodating and friendly for the most part. NEGATIVES>>>Things at the front desk could have run a little smoother. (When I checked in at 1 a.m. to my reserved room, there was someone else already in that room and I apparently woke them up trying to get my room key to work. Front desk was unaware. Check out was also an event. One clerk, very long wait.) And the room overlooked what I think was the Greyhound bus terminal??? There was a lot of street noise all night long. Sounded like they might have been repairing roads. I would say, if you do not have to be anywhere at any specific time or are just coming to San Diego for a casual stay, this would be a good deal. But if you are traveling on business, you might look for something a little more professional.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Zoezer
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Bristol attending a conference at the convention center. The location is excellent. The hotel is cheerful and modern, with lots of beautiful artwork. My room was large and comfortable. The housekeeping was so-so, and my minibar fridge was never cold despite my request to have this fixed. However, I found the front desk staff very pleasant and accomodating. Breakfast and room service dinner from the restaurant were quite good. The free high speed internet connection in the room was a plus. Overall I enjoyed my stay, and found it good value next to the overpriced chain hotels offered through the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself aggravation, DONT stay here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, so you might think this place is a 'cool boutique hotel' BUT it is NOT. Of course, it is trying to ride the wave of popularity and project itself as a small/independent/boutique, but the execution is horrible. Valet, Bell, Desk, Restaurant and Bar staff are all incompetent and clueless as to how to tend to the needs of guests. Part of what makes a boutique/small hotel appealing is the attention to detail and sevice oriented mindset. None of that here. I think it is either a management problem or an underlying pressure causing (under)staffed to just CYA. Although it aspires to be and the staff are poorly trained and insensitive to visitors needs. It is unfortunate. The potential is there and the location of the hotel is good. Too bad there is an total lack of hospitality and attention. For example- -valet refused to bring my car to get something out of it because hotel uses a private lot down the street and the hotel would have to pay the lot to repark it! -desk people uncourteous and lacked knowledge of general hotel issues. -upon arrival bell guy left my bags in lobby for an hour until I finally took them to my room myself. -restaurant service is deplorable, slow, and rude. food arrived cold. I suggest that you DO NOT stay here, barring 10 positive reviews in a row. Truly a disappointment and unfortunate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs to do some cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible. We stood outside for quite some time before someone finally came to help us check in our car-- after going to guest check-in twice. It was 11pm, we had our 8 month old daughter, and she was tired, plus it was cold. When I initially made the reservation I requested a rollaway crib, nothing was in the room. I called downstairs and we had to wait another 30 minutes for that to arrive. We ended up just having her share our bed because the crib actually looked pretty dirty (rusty in spots) and old. Our room had trash in the trash can, and just overall appeared dingy. We weren't impressed, and they should reconsider their rates until they want to at least make it a bit cleaner. I've stayed at numerous boutique hotels, and never have they been this bad. The following night we got to enjoy the music from the street below because the windows are that thin. The rooms were drafty and the heating worked poorly. Won't ever return.

HotelInfo.Name: Bristol Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1055 First Ave, San Diego, CA 92101-4890
